Who are we?

PayQwick, Inc. (“PayQwick” or the “Company”) a fast growing start-up in electronic-payment space, is a compliance - based electronic payment hub that enables state - legal marijuana commerce to transact throughout the entire supply chain. PayQwick ensures compliance with federal and state laws while minimizing cash transactions and increasing convenience and safety for both consumers and businesses. As such, PayQwick normalizes marijuana commerce by reducing the risk of violent crime, illegal money laundering and noncompliance with state marijuana laws. PayQwick began its operations in the State of Washington in October 2015 and is in the process of expanding in to other states where the sale of marijuana is legal, regulated and tracked by the state.

PayQwick has one of the most robust BSA/AML compliance programs in the cannabis industry, combining the functionality of a B2B electronic payment hub with a stringent compliance platform.

JOB TITLE - MASTER GROWER

JOB SUMMARY

Manage a large-scale multi-warehouse industrial cannabis cultivation in a professional environment. Perform all the tasks in the grow to include cloning, transplanting, feeding plants, defoliation, topping, flushing, preventative sprays, trimming, packaging, inventory management and tracking.

DUTIES

  • Perform all grow tasks including but not limited to: cloning, transplanting, feeding plants, defoliation, super cropping, topping, flushing, foliar and preventative sprays, trimming, packaging, waste disposal and inventory management.
  • Assist in hiring, training and scheduling staff and oversee entire staff through all processes including cloning, transplanting, topping, defoliating, trimming, packaging, etc.
  • Maintain and manage a large-scale multi-warehouse grow facility in a clean and organized work environment.
  • Develop and/or maintain grow warehouse protocols and nutrient regiment
  • Schedule plant maintenance and maintain organization to keep costs down
  • Track and catalog each strain from clone to flower to harvesting.
  • Execute preventative maintenance to eliminate mold, powdery mildew, spider mites, root aphids, fungus etc.
  • Mastery of various growing methods including aeroponics, micronutrients, beneficial bacteria, PH, PPM etc.
  • Knowledge and experience with container systems - hydro, coco, soil etc.
  • Expert knowledge of temperature, humidity, plant diseases, insects and fungi, and treatment
  • Constantly learning about new techniques, individual strains, high yield recipes, controlled stress, lighting and set ups.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of strains including Sativa, Indica and Hybrids and understand the medicinal implementation and effects of strains
  • Facility maintenance and troubleshooting as required

SKILLS / QUALIFICATIONS

  • Growing for 5+ years including at least 3 years at commercial operation as Master Grower.
  • Expertise and knowledge of large scale commercial plant grow including nutrient, mediums, lighting, temperature, humidity etc.
  • Expertise and knowledge of plant diseases, insects, fungi and treatments
  • Up to date and advanced knowledge of the cannabis plant growing techniques, new strains and genetics
  • Well organized and attention to detail is a must
  • Bachelor's degree in Horticulture, Science or Botany is preferred

Job Type: Full-time

Required education: Bachelor's Degree

Required experience: Commercial growing 3+ years as Master Grower

LOCATION: Santa Monica, California

COMPANY PROFILE: Since 2006, this clinic has offered medical/dosed cannabis treatments (via cannabis pills) to patients suffering from chronic and serious health conditions and who often cannot tolerate the side effects of other therapies. The practice is led by an experienced internal medicine physician, who believes in using medical cannabis as both an alternative and complementary therapy to other treatments. The practice employs a small, but dedicated, staff of 8 individuals, which includes 2 physicians and 1 psychiatrist.

POSITION DESCRIPTION: The new physician will see an average of 6 to 8 patients per day. Appointments tend to be longer than average due to a focus on education and collaboration with patients. Approximately 70% of patients are referred by other providers due to inability to tolerate the side effects of pharmaceutical drugs. All patients are adults suffering from serious, chronic conditions; most are in some level of chronic pain. The practice utilizes an EHR. There are no evening, weekend, or on-call responsibilities.

REQUIREMENTS:

- California medical license

- DEA

- training in internal medicine or integrative medicine

Hi,

We're Budsy, a cannabis tech start-up based in West Hollywood offering one-touch personalized delivery. We're rapidly growing and are looking to add another member to our team.

Operations

You will match people placing orders with the best strain that fits their profile. In essence, the same task as a budtender, but done through a virtual dashboard. The candidate we're looking for has an expansive knowledge of cannabis strains and is great at providing quality customer service.

Business Development

You will reach out to dispensaries and other potential partners to establish and maintain a business relationship with Budsy. Our ideal candidate is active in the cannabis community or is looking to get their foot in the door.

Social Media

You will post and maintain our presence on our social networks. The ideal candidate has experience managing social media accounts, can independently create visual content and written copy, and has a friendly and engaging, yet professional online persona.

Job Summary

Sales Associate, CANN Media

THE COMPANY

CANN Media Group, LLC (CMG) is a national business-to-business (B2B) media organization serving the emerging cannabis and hemp industries. Our products include: events, publications, digital offerings and social media marketing.

THE INDUSTRY

Legal marijuana is one of the fastest-growing business sectors in the United States, and as legalization expands cannabis will soon be included among the world's leading industries. Business sectors include: horticulture and agriculture, biopharm, alternative medicine, retail and distribution.

OVERVIEW

The Account Executive is responsible for managing a pipeline of sales opportunities, prospecting, establishing and maintaining relationships, and presenting clients with custom marketing solutions. Ideal candidate should be highly experienced in advertising sales and corporate communication. Candidate should be energetic, professional, persuasive, well organized, and comfortable with presenting to small and large companies and agencies. Must also be able to travel frequently to meet with clients and attend trade functions and events.

CMG is seeking an in-house, well qualified, passionate and goal driven media sales professional to work in our Woodland Hills office.

Responsibilities Include:

  • Allocating the time required to gain a complete understanding of the market and market needs.
  • Achieve monthly and quarterly sales targets.
  • Prepare insertion orders.
  • Actively meeting with clients to further the business relationship.
  • Maintain an active list of accounts while developing new business.
  • Prepare for client meetings, presentations and brainstorming sessions.
  • Develop and maintain excellent relationships with clients and agencies through identifying clients’ advertising needs and developing customized solutions to meet those needs.
  • Create sales and marketing sponsorship/promotion plans, literature and advertising proposals for clients.
  • Work with internal departments to manage account stewardship.
  • Attend sales meetings, training sessions and client meeting and promotions
  • Understand and communicate the resources, products and capabilities of all CANN Media assets.

Requirements:

  • A passion for the cannabis industry.
  • Minimum of 5 years of direct sales experience.
  • Comprehensive understanding of social media platforms and how to leverage them effectively.
  • Relationship builder with an engaging personality.
  • Goal driven and self-motivated individual that challenges self to exceed targets.

Feel Good Sales Group (FGSG) is looking for regional sales reps across California. Applicants should be experienced in sales, entrepreneurial minded, highly motivated, reliable and passionate about cannabis.

About FGSG:

A more comprehensive and professional sales solution for cannabis brands.

Position Summary:

While this industry is super freakin’ cool, exciting and booming with opportunity, it is a lot more challenging and dynamic than you would expect. The reality of being an outside sales rep is extremely demanding. Dealing with often unorganized, unreliable and unprofessional people can be frustrating and this industry is full of them. Most buyers at dispensaries are difficult to find and get a hold of. Dispensaries will strategically keep outsiders from knowing who the buyer is.

To be successful, you will need to be resilient, tenacious, organized and cool-as-a-fan. Suits and squares don’t get far in this industry, but neither do unprofessional stoners.

As a FGSG sales rep you will be representing some of the most reputable cannabis brands to dispensaries and deliveries. You will work with other bright, healthy hustlers like yourself, under supportive management. Your job will be to maximize sales in your territory by opening, servicing and managing accounts, cultivating meaningful relationships, providing superior service and support, promotions, inventory management, merchandising and weekly reporting.

This is an extremely unique opportunity to get into the cannabis industry with a good company.

Job Description:

  • Visiting accounts, calling, emailing, logging everything into our CRM, following up persistently, selling, promoting and lots of following up.
  • Open new accounts – Identify and qualify key accounts, set up appointments, and present our brands to buyers.
  • Cultivate personal relationships – Continually engage with dispensary staff and patients, building trust, brand loyalty and sales through continual face-to-face interaction as well as phone, email and social network.
  • Telling our brands’ stories in a passionate and compelling way, educating bud-tenders about what makes our brands’ products special, and stoking them out!
  • Sampling and promotions – Develop and execute promos to drive more patients to dispensary accounts and build brand awareness
  • Increase brand and product awareness
  • Educate patients about our brands’ products
  • Encourage trial of products through sampling
  • Driving sales through promotional offers
  • Push awareness of events through social media
  • Inventory Management – Stay diligently on top of inventory to maximize sales.
  • Merchandising – Ensure that our brands’ products are optimally positioned and merchandised with display units, POP and collateral.
  • Weekly Reports

Job Requirements

  • 3+ years of sales experience
  • Cannabis industry and product knowledge is a big plus
  • Valid driver’s license
  • Medical marijuana physician recommendation
  • Employment background check

Perks

  • Be part of a fun, successful, synergetic and rewarding team of awesome people
  • Work in a booming industry that is helping improve lives physically, mentally, emotionally, spiritually, financially, and socially.
  • Lots of opportunities for growth
  • Learn a ton about a new and emerging industry

jobDescription:
Job Summary

The word “budtender” is derived from the bartender, and in some ways the job is similar, but in other ways it’s very different. Unlike a bar, people are not allowed to enjoy their product in the store, so although there’s going to be some interaction with customers, it’s going to be before the sale and without consumption. This means you have to be customer-ready and capable of being knowledgeable and sociable without smoking or eating cannabis.

Requirements of budtender jobs include:

Friendly with good customer service. Knowledge of marijuana strains and productsGood organizational skills. Clean criminal record. Trustworthiness and reliability. And, of course, any other qualifications you might bring, especially if you are thinking about moving up in our organization.

Working well with others in team environments and on your own in the field will be major keys to success at Cura. This position is best suited for “go-getters”, who thrive in startup environments.

A successful candidate will have these three primary deliverables

  • Be passionate about the cannabis industry and Cura’s “ Everything is Possible ” culture. That is at the heart of Who We Are , and every team member must feel the same sense of ownership , innovation , and hustle as we shape the industry across the U.S and around the world.

Description:

At GreenSTOP, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems in robotics, artificial intelligence and automated systems that impact people’s lives around the world today, and for generations to come. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have a lot of fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they’re making history.

GreenSTOP LLC is a revolutionary technology company in the world's fastest emerging market. GreenSTOP's patented technology will disrupt an entire industry. Our organization is looking for a passionate VP of Engineering to join our elite team. Our team is made up of some of the most talented engineers and designers in the industry. Our GreenSTOP VP of Engineering, with management responsibility, will assist in commercialization of smart machines. This opportunity offers stock options and an experience that will be priceless. Our team is working with celebrities and elite investors. At GreenSTOP LLC we provide a culture of teamwork, entrepreneurship, leadership, research/development, vision, confidence, and strategy.

Our GreenSTOP VP of Engineering will get the opportunity to join an elite team that has what it takes to change the world with technology and innovation. In addition, this position will be a part of the exciting journey of Venture Capital, which will be featured on our upcoming reality show about GreenSTOP called Venture Cannabis. Venture Cannabis is currently being shopped to some of the largest networks on the planet. GreenSTOP's mission is to deliver an expedited, user-friendly service for customers to purchase high quality products at economical prices. GreenSTOP will bring accountability, improved health/safety standards, solutions to government concerns, amazing customer service/experience, and a next generation approach to an industry with great opportunities for technological innovations.

RESPONSIBILITIES SUMMARY

The Vice President of Product Engineering is responsible for providing leadership in planning, establishing and directing all aspects of the company’s engineering policies, objectives and initiatives based on product and profitability goals. Responsible for supplying and maintaining adequate resources for all Product Engineering (Engineering) functions in the pursuit of the company’s strategic goals and operational plans.

Duties and responsibilities include the following:

  • Establishes current and long range objectives, plans, and policies, subject to approval by the CEO.
  • Partners with the Chief Technology Officer and Engineering Technology staff to foster one organizational approach for Product Engineering and Engineering Technology.
  • Directly supervises employees in a Product Engineering Department. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, training and developing employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.
  • Develops or reviews Product Engineering budgets and resource allocation to ascertain project time frame and funding limitations, and to determine methods and procedures for accomplishment of programs and projects in accordance with allotment of funds to various phases of project.
  • Responsible for strategic planning, budgets and control of project expenditures.
  • Creates a technical vision and technology roadmap for the company and plans for implementation of new technical projects or product lines.
  • Dispenses advice, guidance, direction, and authorization to carry out major plans and procedures, consistent with established policies and corporate approval.
  • Performs detailed and continuing analysis of product offerings as compared to competition.
  • Provides technical advice to assist in solving problems and continuous process and product improvement.
  • Develops a climate within the department to foster a high level of employee motivation, performance, and commitment. Develops staffing plan and reviews work plan and schedules for each phase of a project in accordance with time limitations and funding.
  • Works with other departments to ensure completion of programs on time and within budget.
  • Represents organization with major customers and the public.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws.

Qualifications

SKILLS AND ABILITIES

  • Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, customers, particularly with all customers, suppliers, and the general public. Superior communication skills and can present his/her ideas in a clear, concise manner; one who can adapt his/her communication style as needed.
  • Ability to apply principles of logical or scientific thinking to a wide range of intellectual and practical problems.
  • Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.
  • Develop and implement strategic initiatives and solutions.
  • Lead, direct, and control development projects to include planning, defining requirements and budget, systems design, programming, and controls, analysis testing.
  • Demonstrated strong leadership, collaboration, project management, problem-solving, change management and influencing skills.
  • Comfortable and well-practiced leading teams.
  • Experience serving as a technical advisor to a senior leadership team.
  • Unquestioned integrity.
  • Consensus builder with strong persuasion skills.
  • A highly motivated team player.
  • A good listener.
  • Must be flexible with the ability to change, adapt and grow.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or another technical discipline. Master’s level degree in a scientific or MBA a plus.
  • Mechatronics Engineering experience required.
  • Minimum of 15 years of related experience in senior level engineering leadership.
  • Assignments require considerable knowledge of management practice and policy interpretation or some combination of education and experience that would enable senior technical capability allowing the incumbent to independently evaluate, select, and apply techniques and standards.
  • Strategic planning and budgeting experience.
  • This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee(s) incumbent in this position. Employee(s) will be required to follow any other job-related instructions and to perform any other job-related duties requested by any person authorized to give instructions or assignments.

WORK ENVIRONMENT/PHYSICAL DEMANDS

  • Exposure to shop environment such as noise, dust, odors and fumes.
  • Occasionally required to lift up to 20 lbs.
  • Regularly required to sit, stand, bend, reach and move about facilities.

Overview:
As our Director of Content Marketing, you will be responsible for Weedmaps overall content strategy, execution, and syndication. You'll develop a comprehensive content strategy to drive awareness and build our brand among both educators and students in higher education and create highly compelling content to establish Weedmaps as a leader in the cannabis industry. You'll hire and manage (internal and external) writers, producers, and content agencies, to create rich content to reach key business objectives. To achieve your goals You'll collaborate cross-functionally with other business leaders throughout our Marketing, Product, and G&A organizations.

Weedmaps is the Cloud platform powering the Cannabis industry. We help millions of consumers learn about and find Cannabis and thousands of organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their Cannabis business, whether they are a grower, producer, retailer or consumer. Our products are engineered for security, reliability, and scalability, running the full stack from application infrastructure to end user devices. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers, medical institutions and government agencies see the benefits of an industry platform.

In this role, you'll be involved with producing all content from beginning to end.

Responsibilities:
-----------------

  • You'll create and lead our content development and syndication strategy. This includes owning the budget, and managing our content platform, in terms of structure, aesthetics, and tools.

  • You'll hire and manage the in-house content team to scale content production. You'll also continue to grow and manage our freelance writers and other 3rd party agencies to address Weedmaps content needs.

Preferred qualifications:

Manage a large-scale industrial cannabis cultivation in a Portland, OR. Perform all the tasks in the grow to include cloning, transplanting, feeding plants, defoliation, topping, flushing, preventative sprays, trimming, packaging, inventory management and tracking.

  • Up to date and advanced knowledge of the cannabis plant growing techniques, new strains and genetics
  • Well organized and attention to detail is a must
  • Bachelor's degree in Horticulture, Science or Botany is preferred

Client: Sun God Medicinals LLC

Position: Account Management

Territory: Portland, Oregon and Surrounding Counties

Hours: Full-time exempt

Starting pay: Exempt, $35,000/year + Incentives

ABOUT US

Lucky Gap Staffing contracts with multiple companies to provide employment services. This position is with Sun God Medicinals LLC. They were founded in the Summer of 2014 with a mission to blend & extract quality healing herbs from Southern Oregon to help consumers address specific symptom needs. From herbal teas, tinctures, elixirs, topicals, edibles, and extracts the Sun God Meds product line is aimed at providing specific relief. The herb processor produces both an herbal products line and a hemp/cannabis compounding line of products. In November 2016 Sun God Medicinals received an Oregon state cannabis processors license to make and sell cannabis products to OLCC licensed retailers. In addition the manufacturer produces a line of single herb extracts; Ra Herbals, Ra Hemp, and Ra Cannabis.

JOB SUMMARY

The Portland, Oregon Account Representative needs to be an enthusiastic, entrepreneurial, career minded individual, with a strong work ethic and a commitment to teamwork. This position is in the sales and marketing department and reports to both the Sun God Medicinals’ Operations and Sales Managers and has responsibility for assisting with the many facets of the sales and marketing effort including supporting sales goals, developing and extending various marketing programs, and proposal preparation. The sales and marketing position is responsible for planning and implementing sales, marketing, and product development programs in the Portland, Oregon region, both short and long range, targeted toward existing and new markets by performing the following duties personally or with sales and brand managers. Heavy emphasis is placed on active sales and account management. The Sun God Medicinals’ product line consists of herbal and hemp products to be sold to general stores like grocery, wellness, and gift shops as well as cannabis products to be sold to OLCC licensed retailers.

Responsibilities and Duties

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Builds and manages a book of business totaling $900,000+ per year.
  • Prospect and manage existing accounts while showing incremental growth through new account generation
  • Grow distribution and merchandising in area retail outlets while increasing base accounts through additional sales
  • Meet or exceed monthly, quarterly, and yearly new business and revenue goals
  • Establish promotional plans and execute with key customers
  • Develop professional business relationships with a wide array of people through strategic business approaches
  • Network and build relationships within territory in order to further business relationships and drive preference for Sun God Medicinals’ products
  • Manage and maintain the assets and tools provided by the company
  • Cold call prospective customers, by phone and in person, to expand sales pipeline and solicit orders.
  • Ability and commitment to independently learn a vast product offering, with minimum supervision.
  • Travel within geography/territory, up to 75% is required.
  • Initiates sales process by building relationships; qualifying potential; scheduling appointments.
  • Develops sales by making initial presentation; explaining product and service enhancements and additions; introducing new products and services.
  • Closes sales by overcoming objections; preparing contracts.
  • Contributes information to sales strategies by evaluating current product results; identifying needs to be filled; monitoring competitive products; analyzing and relaying customer reactions.
  • Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.
  • Enhances department and organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.
  • Achieves marketing and sales operational objectives by contributing marketing and sales information and recommendations to strategic plans and reviews; preparing and completing action plans; implementing quality and customer-service standards; resolving problems; completing audits; identifying trends;
  • Meets marketing and sales financial objectives by forecasting requirements;
  • Assist with annual gross-profit plans by forecasting and collaborating on annual sales quotas for regions; projecting expected sales volume and profit for existing and new products; analyzing trends and results; establishing pricing strategies; recommending selling prices; monitoring costs, competition, supply, and demand.
  • Willingness to assist with social media content and management.
  • Sustains rapport with key accounts by making regular visits; exploring specific needs; anticipating new opportunities and working towards a “Completely Satisfied” account experience.
  • Provides information by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing data and trends.
  • Protects organization's value by keeping information confidential.
  • Accomplishes marketing and organization mission by completing related results as needed.

Qualifications and Skills

Competencies

  • Business Acumen
  • Communication Proficiency
  • Customer/Client Focus
  • Leadership
  • Presentation Skills
  • Problem Solving/Analysis
  • Results Driven
  • Strategic Thinking
  • Technical Capacity
  • Time Management
  • Territory Management

Skills and Qualifications:

  • Establishes Partnerships
  • Alliances
  • Prospecting Skills
  • Meeting Sales Goals
  • Foster Teamwork
  • Planning
  • Building Relationships
  • People Skills
  • Initiative
  • Customer Focus
  • Emphasizing Excellence

Work Environment

This job operates in a home office environment as well as on the road within the account territory. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, and copier/printer/scanners.

Physical Demands

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear people in a variety of environments. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms and requires the ability to occasionally lift office products and supplies up to 20 pounds.

Travel

Travel is primarily local during the business day, although some out-of-the-area and overnight travel may be expected.

REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience in consumer packaged goods. Retail sales and merchandising preferred.
  • A knowledge of applicable FDA herbal supplement and OLCC cannabis rules and regulations;
  • Over 21 with Oregon Marijuana Handler’s Card
  • Well documented, strong selling skills including prospecting, qualifying, negotiation, presentation and closing skills.
  • Exceptional communication and teaming skills.
  • Excellent time management and multi-tasking skills in a challenging environment
  • Demonstrated experience working in sales or marketing team environment
  • Solid experience with CRM software (e.g. Salesforce, Pipedrive, SAPone, ect) and MS Office (particularly MS Excel)
  • Strong organizational and follow-up skills
  • Valid driver's license with favorable driving record.
  • College degree preferred and one year experience in sales, marketing, and/or business development.

Benefits

Great benefits package: Medical, vision, dental insurance; sick leave; paid vacation, vehicle allowance and more.

companyName: Kelan John Farrell-Smith for President in 2020
jobDescription:
Details

Kelan John Farrell-Smith (R-CA) is a true Washington outsider, not rich or famous in any way, but is a young, 35-year-old political up-and-comer who is tired of seeing the same few (unqualified) families being promoted for political office by the media. He holds a B.A. in Psychology from California State University-Northridge, an M.S. in Clinical Psychology and an M.B.A. in International Business from California Lutheran University, as well as an M.A. in Politics from Claremont Graduate University. He is a political scholar, and is also an accomplished musician, having performed numerous classical masterworks as a member of the choir at Pomona College. He works as a consultant.

Kelan was a longtime Democrat, having voted for Gore in 2000, Kerry in 2004, and Obama in 2008 and 2012. He supported the notion of a female President, and was a supporter of Elizabeth Warren in 2016. When it became public knowledge that the Hillary Clinton campaign had colluded with Debbie Wasserman-Schultz, former Democratic Party Chairperson, to prevent Warren and Bernie Sanders from competing with Hillary on an even playing field in the 2016 Democratic primaries, Kelan became enraged with the Democratic Party, switched parties, and ultimately voted for Donald Trump.

After watching Trump's performance in The White House for the past year (lots of controversies, firings, etc.), Kelan regrets his decision to vote for Trump, and has decided to go right at him by running as a Republican. He contemplated running as a Democrat, because he supports LGBTA+ equality, inclusion in the workplace, and the legalization of medicinal cannabis, but feels that it would be more efficient to challenge Donald Trump directly as a Republican, given the fact that many Republicans are dismayed by Donald Trump's short tenure in office.

Kelan was educated by many prominent conservative (and liberal) professors while a doctoral student at Claremont, and respects the opinions of both parties, as Americans.

Kelan's primary campaign platform is that of true campaign finance reform consisting of equal funding for all presidential candidates, because he thinks that every constitutionally eligible person should be given a chance to run for political office, not just the rich and the famous.

Currently, Mr. Farrell-Smith's campaign is seeking motivated political interns who would like to see real change in Washington, DC. He favors the idea that being educated in politics should outweigh being rich or famous, at least as far as presidential campaigns are concerned.

Job responsibilities: cold calling, polling, fundraising, etc.

Work experience: no prior political campaign experience is required

Required education: a bachelor's or master's degree in political science, politics, constitutional law, or political philosophy (political theory) is preferred, however current undergraduate college students in those fields, as well as other related fields, are encouraged to apply

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Master's

Details

Job Summary

Welcome!

This is Jessika Mankin, LMT of Soothing Therapeutic Massage. I have 2 rooms in a beautiful office in Midtown Fort Collins and I am looking for 1 or 2 holistic health practitioners to join me in my busy practice. I am open to Massage Therapists, Estheticians, Acupuncturists, Chiropractors, Yoga Therapist or other Holistic Health Professionals. Depending on how many clients you already have and how integrated you want to be with my business, you would have the option of being an independent contractor with an hourly room rent or a full employee. Either way, you would be joining me under the umbrella of Soothing Therapeutic Massage and will be included on my website and online scheduler with exposure to my 1100+ client base.

I have 12 years of experience and over 1000 hours of training from schools in Austin and San Diego. My style is very thorough and different from others in the area. I blend a relaxing circulatory massage with deep tissue sculpting, Asian modalities, gentle stretching and energy work. I also have an in-depth knowledge of nutrition, various holistic modalities and a yoga teacher training certification. I was lucky to have many wonderful teachers and I would love to pass on what I have learned to others.Massage therapists that join my practice, we can meet regularly to exchange ideas and techniques with each other, creating a sense of community.

Ideal candidates:

- Genuinely enjoy helping people- Have a passion for learning about the human body and how to help it.- Are dependable, hardworking and honest

- Enjoy working with a small group of like-minded MT's in a non-corporate environment.- Are licensed and insured in Colorado.

- Have a friendly, positive attitude and high standards for professionalism and hygiene.- Are interested in holistic health, nutrition, and energy work.

- Feel comfortable working with CBD (Cannabis) lotion (if you are a massage therapist). It doesn't contain THC or get you high, and it has wonderful health benefits!

- It's a bonus if you can perform hot stone massages, since I bought a brand new kit and stones!

If you are interested, please tell me about yourself, your experience, if you currently have clients, and what your ideal schedule would be.

Sat, Sun, Mon, Tues, and Wed are available all day and the remaining days of the week are available before 1pm.

I look forward to hearing from you!

Jessika Mankin, LMT

Soothing Therapeutic Massage

www.soothingtm.com

The top cannabis oil producer in the state is looking for a passionate and professional individual to fill the role of Laboratory Technician. We are looking for an individual who will be working with a variety of Laboratory/production tasks. This individual must be able to multi-task, work quickly and efficiently, and be adaptable to change priorities and tasks as needed. We have a very fast- paced environment as we continue to grow and expand. Must be motivated, trustworthy, and a team player.

Laboratory Technician Job Responsibilities:

Carry out laboratory production; intake raw material; enter and track material quantities in CTS system; create batch records a given process; troubleshooting and resolving problems; maintaining logs and record books; maintaining glassware; daily lab cleanup.

Laboratory Technician Job Duties:

  • Follow Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
  • Intake and Process raw cannabis material into a crude concentrate.
  • Document information by creating and maintaining accurate batch records.
  • Secondary cannabinoid processing; prepare cannabinoid concentrate for specific secondary refining processes.
  • Carry out cannabinoid concentrate refining processes to completion with clear and well defined labeling to ensure absolute traceability throughout the process.
  • Navigate Cannabis Tracking System (CTS) and execute common commands for a given project.
  • Keep equipment operational by following operating instructions; troubleshooting breakdowns; performing preventive maintenance.
  • Keep laboratory inventorying in stock; placing orders; verifying receipt.
  • Resolves problems by examining and evaluating data; selecting corrective steps.
  • Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading technical publications.
  • Enhances laboratory and organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.
  • Maintains glassware by picking-up, cleaning, washing, sterilizing, and organizing.

Laboratory Technician Skills and Qualifications:

Chemistry Techniques, Lab Environment, Solvent Extraction, Cannabis Knowledge, Chemical Properties of Cannabinoids, Cryogenic Procedures, Record Keeping, Data Tracking, Safe Lab Practices, Equipment Calibration and Maintenance, Chemical Safety, Supply Management, Self-Development

Position Summary:

The Technical Director reports to the Company President, and is responsible for the daily operations and project management needs of the Sensi Scientific (Medical Cannabis) Division of R.I. Analytical while also adhering to the quality system.

The Technical Director assigns tasks, provides operational support to departmental staff, reviews and approves data, coordinates completion of QA/QC tasks, and actively participates in the daily laboratory production of the Division with oversight from the President. Operational support includes, but is not limited to: method development; handling of special projects; scheduling of work tasks based on priority status, hold times and due dates; resolution of issues encountered during daily production; maintenance and upkeep of relevant equipment and instrumentation; ordering of necessary supplies and inventory control. This position requires the active participation in the training and oversight of departmental staff, thereby ensuring compliance with the quality system, facility security and laboratory standard operating procedures, health & safety regulations, as well as company policies.

Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Directs, researches, investigates, and implements the best approaches for all aspects of laboratory operations and management in order to ensure on time delivery of analytical data to internal and external clients while maintaining a reputation for excellence and providing complete client satisfaction
  • Effectively manages workload to ensure that any hold times and all requested turnarounds are met. When necessary, alerts the President of an inability to meet turnaround times. As projects may warrant, arranges for after hours, weekend and holiday laboratory coverage
  • Ensures that the laboratory has the necessary resources (e.g. laboratory space, personnel, consumable supplies, and equipment) to perform the work of the Division
  • Serves as the primary person responsible for ensuring adherence to the requirements of all certifications and accreditations held by the Division
  • Reinforces the established quality system (quality of data and adherence to written policies and procedures), employee handbook policies, and seeks out areas for improvement within laboratory operations applying principles of continuous improvement
  • Provides yearly review of department SOPs, and schedules other QA/QC related functions within the laboratory such as MDL studies, proficiency testing and the implementation of all corrective and/or preventative actions identified in a timely manner
  • Is available during all hours for consultation with personnel in order to provide direction with regard to technical questions
  • Oversees the hiring, training, supervision, and annual performance evaluation of all applicable laboratory personnel
  • Performs a final review and approves all analytical data produced by the laboratory prior to reporting, in collaboration with the Data Reporting Manager. In certain situations has full authority to review and approve final reports directly
  • Drafts, reviews and accepts laboratory Standard Operating Procedures in conjunction with the Quality Assurance Officer
  • Maintains the Statement of Qualifications and completes the annual Management Review in accordance to ISO 17025 requirements
  • Resolves Corrective Actions with the QA/QC Officer and proposes Preventive Actions
  • Performs method development and validations according to all quality system requirements
  • Stays current with the latest industry developments and market trends; is familiar with what the competition is doing
  • Seeks approval for all laboratory capital expenditures above $500
  • Performs other duties as required or assigned by the President and Vice President.

Qualifications:

Education: Minimum Bachelor's degree (B.S.) in chemistry or related field

Experience: Minimum 5 years of experience in the laboratory analysis of samples

Strong organizational, project management and communication skills

Ability to recognize areas of improvement and implement effective solutions

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

HARVEST is a leading San Francisco medical cannabis dispensary brand focused on redefining the retail cannabis experience. We are seeking to fill a retail manager.

Overview

We are looking for a well-rounded WordPress Developer that is comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment and has extensive experience in troubleshooting software issues within WordPress.  The position will start out as a part-time freelance role with the potential to grow into a full-time salaried position if you prove to be a good fit for our team.  You will report directly to the CEO of Trim.

We would prefer someone that is local to the Denver/Boulder metro area, but will consider remote work outside of Denver for the right candidate.

Your initial task will be to support our clients websites for any software issues that might arise.

About You:

You can provide the highest level of customer support.  You WILL occasionally interact with clients. (Bonus points if you have read “Delivering Happiness” by Tony Hsieh)

You don’t just do enough to get by.  We want to hear your input and expertise!  If you think you can improve our process or work flow.. speak up!

You work well in a collaborative creative environment and don’t hide under your hoodie in the corner all day.

We love what we do and the space that we work in!  Because of that we tend to work a lot of crazy hours, have a lot of fun, and can sometimes forget we are at work.  If you are looking for a traditional 9 – 5 environment we are not going to be a good fit for each other.

Cannabis gives you super powers and does not effect your work ethic.  No couch lock “stoners” here.  We work hard and it can be difficult to keep up if you’re not prepared.

Duties:

  • You will integrate into our support team and help with various client support request on a day-to-day basis
  • Collaborate with design teams
  • Tasked with owning full life-cycle of support request and ensuring all issues are closed in a timely manner
  • Regularly update, maintain, and troubleshoot problems on existing client’s sites
  • Integrate with third-party APIs
  • Implement UX design updates that meet business objectives and user needs
  • Possibility to transition into full site development projects if desired

Requirements:

  • 5+ years Wordpress development experience
  • Strong background in common programming languages such as PHP, XHTML, CSS, jQuery, and Javascript
  • Experience with mobile and responsive web design
  • Experience with automated testing tools and techniques
  • Experience with hosting issues (we tend to role with WPengine)
  • Understanding of web interface and UX design
  • If you have a degree that is cool too – we are more wow’d by experience and extreme work ethic though.
  • Experience in customer facing support role
  • Experience in supporting websites in a real-time environment
  • Excellent organizational and project management skills
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Experience with web-based applications such as Asana, ProsperWorks CRM, Slack, G Suite, etc

Bonus Points:

  • Wow us! We are a creative team that moves fast.  The more skills you have the more impressed we will be.
  • Ability to wear many hats
  • Adobe Creative Suite
  • Understanding of best practices for Search Engine Optimization
  • You can roll a good joint
  • You have a friendly dog or other animal that can join the team

Location:

We would really prefer someone that is currently located in the Denver/Boulder metro area and has a flexible schedule. Support can be feast or famine.  Initially you will be brought in as a 1099 contract employee on a part-time basis to evaluate if we mesh well with our team and culture.  If the trial period goes well the possibilities of growth are endless and you will be expected to eventually manage and build up a team.

**This position is contingent on contract award with an expected start date in Jan. 2018.**

If you send us a traditional resume with no creativity or awesome sauce you will be immediately rejected.  Tell us your favorite travel destination so we know you actually read this whole posting we took the time to write.

TITLE: Packaging and Logistics Manager

Integrative Health Products, LLC., is a product development company. We license innovative products to legal, state-licensed manufacturers in the medical and recreational cannabis industry in order to maximize clients' market share, brand awareness, and consumer education.

Job Summary

The Packaging and Logistics Manager facilitates all supply chain logistics, including packaging, labels, ingredients, and any other necessary purchases for official IHP Licensees. Additionally, the PLM will work with the product development manager to help acquire new packaging and manage new and existing vendor relationships in order to secure better deals for our clients.

This job will require the qualified candidate to be able to read, interpret, and actualize work product compliant with state regulations which may vary from licensee to licensee, manage complete supply chains, and meet the needs of all clients in terms of logistical coordination between vendors and licensees. Additionally, the qualified candidate will be well versed in using communications tools and driving decision making through data analysis.

Job Responsibilities:

1. Source packaging at the direction of the product development manager for new products in the pipeline;

2. Re-order and maintain supplies of all ingredients, packaging, and supplies for IHP licensees as required by the licensee;

3. Manage relationships with all new and existing packaging vendors, including placing orders, negotiating pricing, and managing ship dates to meet deadlines;

4. Understand and act on all state specific packaging requirements for relevant state regulations and work with regulators where necessary to expand;

5. Acquire or generate dielines for packaging to send to graphics team and implement graphics designs with 3rd party label and/or packaging manufacturers;

6. Constantly search for new vendors and remain on the cutting edge of cannabis packaging developments in order to improve style and efficiency of IHP products, bringing new packaging ideas to the developers for discussion;

7. Evaluate costs of all regularly-replenished items, including not only packaging, but other commonly-used production inputs (e.g., nutrients, uniforms, tools) and overhead expenses (e.g., insurance). Identify and pursue cost-saving opportunities.

Candidate Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree or higher majoring in supply chain, finance, engineering or a business related field or equivalent experience (3-5 years experience minimum in related field);
  • Have previous experience in cost analysis and navigating vendor relationships;
  • Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities concurrently with shifting priorities
  • Ability to be a team player as well as work independently
  • Ability to work with all levels of Management
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills including proficiency in Microsoft Office or GSuite
  • Cannabis experience not required

The applicant must be flexible, professional, highly motivated, and able to manage multiple responsibilities and staff and complete tasks efficiently with a high degree of accuracy. This is a paid, full-time position working 8 hour shifts Monday through Friday. Compensation and benefits will be determined based on level of qualifications and experience.

Please include cover letter with resume.

Xabis is seeking a self-motivated and systematic team member who can help develop, manage and execute a production facility in the medical marijuana industry. The individual needs to excel within an independent framework and communicate effectively with management and operations. The talented team member will be responsible for developing and optimizing unit operations related to supercritical solvent extraction, crystallization/filtration, distillation, and chromatography. They will also lead initial efforts in product formulation and manufacturing. The ideal candidate will have strong problem-solving capabilities, excel under stress, and strive for efficient and timely reporting.

The OpS1 is responsible for executing all operations regarding production of finished phytopharmaceutical products, meeting the strict regulations specific to the Texas Codes. Specifically, the OpS1:

  • ensures that all activities are performed safely and in strict accordance with company guidelines; maintains product and company reputation by complying with governing regulations.
  • executes standard operating procedures (SOPs) covering all aspects of processing and manufacturing operations (including safety, environmental, and compliance) in accordance with state and local regulatory requirements.
  • operates the primary extractor process; performs maintenance on high-pressure extractors and support equipment; responsible for startup and shutdown processes of production.
  • performs multi-step product purification processes which may include filtration, distillation, and chromatography.
  • creates intermediate products with precisely tailored characteristics for final product manufacturing.
  • builds products for distribution; configures manufacturing equipment for production runs; dispenses bulk ingredients and blends for final product form and storage; cleans manufacturing equipment and facility.
  • packages and labels products according to strict regulatory practices; builds and tracks shipments to customers.
  • keeps laboratory clean by collecting, disposing of, and logging all hazardous and non-hazardous waste; cleaning of all processing equipment and the manufacturing facility; maintenance of glassware cleaning process.
  • manages inventories needed in production process; manages all materials generated throughout production.
  • maintains meticulous records for all processing and manufacturing steps.
  • collects all hazardous/non-hazardous waste generated by processes and transfers to appropriate collection areas.
  • identifies and implements new technologies and methodologies to improve operations workflow and product quality.
  • interacts with client to discuss results, educate team, and help with marketing needs.
  • adheres to GMP, ISO and NELAC laboratory practices
  • communicates with management team on status of operations; writes technical documents (protocols, manuals, SOPs, white papers, etc.).

Employee Qualifications

The Dispensary Manager is responsible for managing all day-to-day operations of the dispensary in accordance with the State of New Mexico and standards set by Company. The Dispensary Manager provides support to all Cashiers, Dispensary Agents and Patient/Customer Coordinators which includes: scheduling, training, providing policy and procedure updates, keeping updated with industry news and product information. The Dispensary Manager is responsible for ordering and receiving of all inventory and products, arranging deliveries, maintaining agent and facility compliance and cleanliness.

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE, EDUCATION AND SKILLS

Two years of experience in a retail position with managerial responsibilities, preferably in the marijuana industry. Excellent communication skills and attention to detail. Effective time management and ability to multitask. Ability to work in a fast-paced, changing and challenging environment. Proficiency in Windows based software and point of sale applications.

CORE JOB DUTIES

Agent Support and Management:

- Responsible for managing dispensary staff, schedules, inventory and patient/customer relations;

- Serves as a role model and resource for dispensary staff concerning products and services, policies and procedures, industry news and changes in regulations;

- Responds to all agent questions, concerns or suggestions and takes action when necessary to resolve conflicts;

- Responsible for delegating tasks to Cashiers, Dispensary Agents and Patient/customer Coordinators in order to maintain a compliant and clean facility; and

- Coordinates with the upper management to ensure accurate information is communicated to dispensary staff.

- Provides superior customer service for vendors, patient/customers and caregivers;

- Responds to all patient/customer complaints, requests, concerns, suggestions and takes action when necessary to resolve conflicts; and

- Oversees orders and deliveries to ensure accurate order information and timeliness of deliveries.

- Maintain accurate records of all dispensary activities including daily cash reconciliations, patient/customer records, sales, deliveries and returns in accordance with the State of New Mexico and the standards set by Company;

- Maintain inventory control system and perform daily counts of all marijuana and marijuana products in the facility;

- Provide regular inventory, and sales reports to the Management Team.

JOB SKILLS

  • Responsible for well water control.

Details

Job Summary

The Information Technology Services Division (ITSD) of the Washington State Liquor and Cannabis Board (WSLCB) is a fast-paced, quickly adapting part of our business and is integral in finding, implementing and maintaining systems for our agency. At this time, the ITSD is announcing an exciting opportunity for up to two Senior Systems and Software Quality Assurance Analyst (ITS4). These positions elicit business and technical requirements, provide senior system analysis services, and execute functional and non-functional quality assurance activities. In addition, these positions plan work and facilitate business engagement in project activities as well as design and follow requirement and documentation standards to elicit business, functional and technical requirements, design technical solutions, and maintain system documentation that supports application development, configuration, and testing. As the Senior Systems and Software Quality Assurance Analyst, you will establish and maintain technical and architectural documentation standards and mentor and provide leadership to technical resources conducting systems analysis. You will be responsible for working with other application systems analysts and software quality assurance engineers to ensure that work is coordinated and meets project, department and industry standards.

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Elicit and manage requirements for complex solution
  • Elicit functional (business) requirements from internal and external subject matter experts for WSLCB lines of business
  • Elicit non-functional (technical) requirements from WSLCB subject matter experts
  • Serve as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical staff to ensure business needs are clearly defined, understood and translated into technical solutions; conversely, ensure that technical requirements are translated into solution opportunities or constraints for business stakeholders
  • Plan, execute, coordinate and analyze project software quality assurance activities
  • Analyze functional and non-functional requirements for completeness and testability
  • Define, develop and execute manual and automated test cases
  • Define testing strategies for approved acceptance criteria
  • Review test results to confirm that test acceptance criteria has been met
  • Provide consultation to project stakeholders

Qualifications and Skills

Required Qualifications

  • Working level knowledge of requirements elicitation and documentation.
  • Working level knowledge of business analysis planning.
  • Working level technical analytical skills with proven documentation of analysis and recommendation.
  • Working level technical writing skills necessary to create and maintain user requirements and system documentation.
  • Working level knowledge of iterative development techniques, such as Agile.
  • Working level knowledge of test planning.
  • Working level writing skills in test case writing and test execution.
  • Expert workload management skills.
  • Expert presentation, interpersonal, written and oral communication skills when communicating to internal IT personnel as well as users in the business units.

Preferred/Desired Qualifications

  • Working level knowledge of writing and modifying Structure Query Language (SQL) statements.
  • A valid Certification of Competency in Business Analysis (CCBA) or Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) Certification.
  • Experience with Visual Studio Team Services (VSTS) or Team Services Foundation (TFS).
  • An Associate's degree or completion of an accredited vocational training program in an information technology or related program in information technology analysis, system maintenance, or troubleshooting/problem resolution experience, or analyzing, designing, or programming computer systems applications or databases.

OR

  • 3 years of demonstrated experience of information technology experience such as consulting, analyzing, designing, programming, installing, and/or maintaining computer software applications, hardware, telecommunications, or network infrastructure equipment, directing projects, providing customer or technical support in information technology; or administering or supervising staff that performed work in any of these information technology disciplines.

The company is hiring a Flavor Chemist to work in our new state-of-the-art 40,000 sq. ft. cultivation and processing center located in Monterey County, CA.

DISPENSARY FRONT OFFICE COORDINATOR

Sonoma Patient Group is currently recruiting for a full-time, experienced professional to provide reception services and administrative assistance in a fully permitted cannabis dispensary centrally located in Santa Rosa. We are seeking an enthusiastic, motivated individual to be the primary point of contact for patients, visitors and vendors. The front office position requires a professional demeanor and has the primary responsibility of coordinating patient reception, clerical and administrative support, and ensuring that services are provided in an effective and efficient manner. The position includes greeting patients, patient in-take, medical records input and filing. The successful candidate is personable, well-groomed and knowledgeable about medical front office practices, privacy and HIPPA regulations and the cannabis industry. This position also provides support to the Patient Consultants and Managers. The position will be trained by dispensary management and may attend other formal dispensary seminars or schooling. Bi-lingual Spanish/English skills are not required but are highly valued.

This recruitment is limited to applicants with a minimum of two (2) years of experience in a professional office or pharmacy environment. Vocational education is valued but may not be substituted for actual on-the-job experience. The successful candidate must have up-to-date intermediate computer skills using Microsoft Office and ability to quickly gain competency in other industry specific applications. Current regulations require that dispensary employees must be age 21 years or older with a current Medical Cannabis recommendation. Prompt and regular attendance is essential. A high degree of initiative and self-motivation is required together with integrity, honesty, dependability and stability for working within a dynamic environment. The starting wage $15 per hour; a full-time position is offered; however, part-time options may be discussed. Employees working more than 30 hours per week are eligible for a generous employee benefit package.

Interviews are by invitation only; no walk-in interviews are available.

Representative Skills and Duties: This is an extremely busy office location and requires a strong ability to multi-task. The Front Desk Coordinator will provide professional and courteous information to patients and vendors; provide exceptional customer care by promoting and maintaining positive customer relations; maintain knowledge of and closely follow front office procedures; answer and direct incoming phone calls; greet patients and visitors and provide clear direction with the utmost discretion. This individual must facilitate the flow of the front desk incorporating patient accommodation and office productivity; collect new patient information; create, process and maintain patient files; organize, prepare and submit data and reports as directed and maintain and manage current resource materials for the public. In addition, the Front Office Coordinator promotes upcoming events and patient appreciation days and supports event staff as needed, including data entry and word processing.

Sweet Leaf's Grow Department is currently hiring for Spray Techs to join the Team!

This position is primarily responsible for accuracy and efficiency with caretaking of cannabis plants including pesticide administration in accordance to Sweet Leaf policies and procedures while maintaining a clean and safe work environment.

Responsibilities include:

  • Understand and adhere to all MED and Department of Agriculture rules and regulations when it comes to pesticide administration and safety guidelines.
  • Comfortability answering basic questions about pesticide safety procedures and overall usage within your work space.
  • Ability to follow proper procedures with and without supervision after receiving adequate training (checking plants before and after spray to identify problem areas, results of pesticides used, possible issues with the spray itself).
  • Mastery of pesticide application (technique, coverage, reducing plant damage, correct amounts needed for full spray).
  • Correct and accurate documentation (logs, signage, timecards, COWA ordering sheets).
  • Timeliness (preparing for sprays, pace during spray, cleanup, setting / meeting deadlines, sticking to daily agenda, communication with manager / growers, travel time between locations).
  • Spraying plants in an orderly fashion (two deep, starting from the back of the rows and working forward)
  • Plant awareness / knowledge (identifying problem plants, varieties of pests and molds, notifying manager / grower).
  • Pest and disease identification (knowledge of basic pests, signs of damage, how to troubleshoot / eradicate pests).
  • Tying / staking plants (straight stake, extensions, tie angle, position on branch, quantity, proper support, 10-15 min).
  • Tying organization (start in back, work as a team, reorganize row, clean leaves from pots, sweep row).
  • Cleanliness (sweeping rooms after tying and plant work, separating plant waste, cleaning work station and hands).
  • Spray equipment care (dramms, backpacks, respirators, headlamps, suits, correct charger usage, reporting damage).
  • Handling affect plant tissue (remove and dispose of all leaves with signs of powdery mildew, mites, thrips or aphids).
  • Safety (correct and consistent usage of eye protection, ear protection, respirators, proper dress attire, light cycles, pesticide REI, SOP and building safety procedures).

Qualifications:

  • High school diploma or General Education Diploma (GED)
  • Excellent computer, math, language, and reasoning skills
  • Knowledge and familiarity with Cannabis
  • Familiarity with warehouse procedures
  • Colorado driverâ€™s license or State ID card
  • Must be a minimum of 21 years of age
  • Must pass any and all required background checks
  • Must be and remain compliant with any and all legal or company regulations for working in the industry
  • Must be approved by the MED to receive a support badge

Qualified applicants please submit your resume via Indeed!

Documentation:

Job Summary: Section Growers will work under the direction of the Head Grower to perform all growing tasks necessary to produce and maintain crops that consistently meet the standards of Schmidt Bros. Inc.

Section Growers report directly to Head Grower

Section Grower responsibilities and functions:

  • Perform all aspects of growing including watering, fertilization, spraying and testing using grow plan as a guideline
  • Monitor and maintain proper greenhouse environment per crop protocol
  • Identify, track and control disease and pest related issues using IPM practices
  • Place, monitor and replace sticky cards on a regular basis.
  • Place and keep current growing activity tags in each crop
  • Using reports, as determined by management, monitor crop timing and alert management of deviations in expected crop ready date
  • Ã‚ Mix and apply pesticides and PGRs as per label and written grow plan. All such applications must be in compliance with the WPS including pre application posting, sign placement (and timely removal after REI has expired), proper PPE, etc.
  • Maintain written records as directed by Head Grower.
  • Manage assistant grower(s) in performing growing tasks
  • Manage non growing personnel, as assigned by management, in performing plant maintenance tasks (i.e. pinching, spacing, etc.)
  • Communicate with the head grower any crop concerns such as disease or insect problems, plant maintenance needs, etc.
  • Communicate with and assist other section growers as needed
  • Maintain a neat and orderly work area
  • All other duties as assigned

Skills/Qualifications

  • Horticultural or related degree is a plus
  • Ability to stand, climb, squat, twist or bend for long periods of time
  • Must be able to work in extreme greenhouse environments
  • Must be able to work long, flexible hours in peak season with weekends required
  • Must be able to follow both verbal and written instructions
  • Must possess adequate math skills to calculate fertilizer and pesticide rates.
  • Must be reliable and maintain a good attendance record

Job Type: Full-time

Details

Job Summary

Sun Valley Alternative Health Centers is currently searching for an experienced bookkeeper with Quickbooks expertise and immediate availability for a full-time bookkeeper. Sun Valley has 7 accounts that need maintenance. Your responsibilities will include:

-all journal entries into Quickbooks

-monthly bank reconciliations

-weekly credit card reconciliations

-daily cash deposit reconciliations

-inter-company payment transfers and proper balance sheet entries

-report generation

-tax prep-communication and assistance to CPA for tax filing

-communication and assistance to CPA for yearly audits for our Franchise LLC

-communication and assistance to CPA for yearly audits of four of our LLCs that are partially owned by a publicly traded company

This position requires a skilled and experienced professional willing to work directly with the COO. You will have your own dedicated desk space in our Surprise clinic located at 12801 W Bell Rd, but there will be days required to work with the COO in her home office. If you have allergies or concerns regarding dogs and cats, this is not the position for you -- our home office is often visited by the COO's family, including the pets and baby daughter. Additionally, please be aware that our business is adjacent to the cannabis industry. We are not a dispensary, we do not sell, grow, or distribute cannabis -- we are simply the doctors that provide consultations to patients seeking a state approved Medical Marijuana Certification. We are fully legal on both a state and federal level and have no legal conflicts regarding our taxes or services. To learn more about our organization visit our website at www.svmmjcc.com .

PTO, health insurance and 401K benefits are available after 60 days. If you are interested and have the availability and skills described above, please contact us through this ad, send your resume, salary requirements, and an explanation of your experience. References will be checked -- please be prepared to provide them. We are eager to welcome you to our team!

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $16.00 to $22.00 /hour

Required experience:

  • QuickBooks: 1 year
  • Bookkeeping: 1 year

Details

Overview

We are a licensed Medical Cannabis Co. operating since 2012 in the West Valley. We are seeking a Marketing Manager to be responsible for developing, implementing and executing strategic marketing plans for our entire organization (or lines of business and brands within the organization) in order to attract potential patients and retain existing ones.

Day-to-day tasks include managing and coordinating outside marketing and creative staff, leading market research efforts to uncover the viability of current and existing products/services, and liaising with media organizations and advertising agencies.

The Marketing Manager’s skill set includes
Leader & Self Starter
Create Marketing campaign & initiatives
Outdoor Media Management
Social Media Management
In Store Advertising
Intimate understanding of traditional and emerging marketing channels
Excellent communication skills
Ability to think creatively and innovatively
Budget-management skills and proficiency
Professional judgment and discretion that comes from years of experience in the field
Analytical skills to forecast and identify trends and challenges
Familiarity with the latest trends, technologies, and methodologies in graphic design, web design, production, etc.

Daily tasks and duties include:

Daily posting on all Social Media sites
Monitoring and analyzing market trends
Studying competitors’ products and services
Exploring ways of improving existing products and services, and increasing profitability
Identifying target markets and developing strategies to communicate with them
Preparing and managing marketing plans and budgets
Managing the production of promotional material
Liaising with other internal departments such as sales and distribution
Producing reports to monitor results
Presenting findings and suggestions to company directors or other senior managers
Traveling to trade shows, conferences and sales meetings
Supporting and managing a marketing team

Education and Experience
A formal education in a related field and a minimum of 5 years experience is required.

How To Apply:
If you feel that you meet the qualification and are interested in applying, respond to this posting with the following information. All qualified candidates will receive a response BUT we will NOT respond if you do not provide the following:

1) Cover Letter
2) Resume or CV
3) Photo
4) Salary Requirements

jobDescription:

Job Summary

Medical Marijuana Grow facility seeking a FULL-TIME EXPERIENCED TRIMMER & PACKAGER

(1) Packaging Department: Full time (32-40 hours available, 5 days a week) $10-$12/hr starting wage. Duties include pre-packaging our bud into containers for our recreational customers, rolling joints, entering data into POS system, printing labels, organizing buds and concentrates.

(2) Trimmer: Full time (32-40 hours available, 5 days a week) $10-$12/hr starting wage. Trimmer: Work at our trim table with a team of full-timers by your side. Great atmosphere and people. Start at hourly rate go up quickly with a great work ethic, diligence, good attendance, and get to salary rates! We will pay for truly experienced individuals and can provide FULL-TIME hours Monday-Friday. If you are inexperienced we MAY be willing to teach you - but you'll have to have the right work ethic, capability, and willingness to learn!

When you apply PLEASE DETAIL YOUR EXPERIENCE. For example: How many hours you have trimmed, how many cycles, wet or dry or both. etc., Have you ever used Metrc, do you have any packaging experience, etc. We are hiring for these positions ASAP. We are hoping to find energetic, hard working, loyal new members to add to our constantly growing team. Try-out for the position on a week day starting at 8am. If we like you then you start full time asap! Hours are 8-4 Mon-Fri. You MUST BE BADGED.

Send resume, relevant work history, a PICTURE OF YOUR BADGE, and a little about yourself and we will respond with details on the next trial day! Requirements for position 21+, Colorado resident, with absolutely no felony charges, that already has their red card. And preferably has their MMED issued badge. Please send resume, picture of your badge, relevant work history, and a little about yourself and we will get back to you ASAP!

Job Title: Inventory Control Supervisor

Position Summary:

Responsible for the day to day inventory of the dispensary, delivery inventory and oversee production team to ensure proper levels of inventory at all times. Create and develop vendor relationships in conjunction with head purchaser to ensure proper inventory levels, track vendor consignment accounts and facilitate payment due to vendors.

Responsibilities and Duties

Duties and Responsibilities:

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Oversee dispensary team including but not limited to: Inventory, Production, Delivery Inventory Delivery Drivers, Dispatchers
  • Ensure proper time is effectively split between departments as needed
  • Ensure back stock of all delivery products are kept to par levels
  • Ensure all products are kept in their ideal state to preserve freshness and quality of each product
  • Ensure all technology platforms are updated with our most current information (Weedmaps, Leafly, Delivery Platforms, etc)
  • Coordinate daily specials with Lead Buyer to ensure proper turnover of inventory and selling out of expiring products
  • Oversee monthly inventory and report any loss runs to partners & operations officers
  • Communicate effectively with FHO managers and production employees to identify any current or upcoming needs
  • Be cognizant of marketing calendar and upcoming events to anticipate ordering needs
  • Ensure Production team is always busy and on task
  • Handle all orders, deliveries, receiving, returns, and exchanges with vendors
  • Assist operations team in creating sales incentives for the sales staff
  • Approve all invoices for payables and ensure clear communication with accounting department
  • Communicate effectively with operations and accounting department to coordinate expected vendor reconciliation payouts
  • Responsible for receiving all product, creating new items, deleting old items, checking in products, scanning invoices, loading to vendor docs
  • Responsible for all vendor payments and account upkeep
  • Responsible for all office and MMJ product inventory and orders
  • Coordinate flower exchange from safe > day cage > floor
  • Ensure jars are reassigned with new strains and ensure proper pricing and labeling of all products on shelves
  • Manage delivery inventory, ensure cases are properly stocked and inventoried each day

Qualifications and Skills

Qualifications:

  • At least 1 year management experience in high volume establishments with extensive knowledge in the cannabis industry
  • Must be able to input and access information in the POS system, delivery systems, marketing outlets, computers, etc
  • Must be comfortable learning new skills
  • Must have a hands-on, proactive self starter

Skills and Attitudes:

Must be motivated, hard-working, and passionate. This position requires someone who is a strong leader with the ability to handle multiple tasks and responsibilities.

  • Must have ability to:

ï® Perform all job functions with attention to detail, speed and accuracy

ï® Prioritize and organize

ï® Be a clear thinker, remain calm, and resolve problems using good judgment

ï® Lead by example and ensure that your team executes the game plan laid out for them

ï® Understand guest service needs

ï® Work cohesively as a team with co-workers

ï®

Education:

Must have one or more of the following:

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree (B.A.) from a four-year college or university
  • Four yearsâ€™ relevant experience and/or training
  • Equivalent combination of education and experience

Certificates, Licenses, and Registrations:

  • Valid California Driverâ€™s License
  • Valid California Medical Marijuana Dr.â€™s Recommendation

Physical Requirements:

  • Must be able to stand/walk for up to 6 hours at a time
  • Must be able to sit for up to 8 hours at a time
  • Must be able to lift at least 50 pounds safely and properly
  • Ability to work in a stressful, fast-paced environment
  • Must be able to work days, nights, holidays and weekends
