Job Summary

Do you have what it takes to be a part of an industry leading cannabis company? We are Mayflower Medicinals â€“ a company dedicated to delivering the best products and services possible to the patients of Massachusetts.

Mayflower is one of the few license holders in Massachusetts and as such we are uniquely positioned for market leadership. We will be opening one of the 3 Boston approved dispensaries. In addition, we have invested in a 36,000sf state of the art cultivation facility to ensure maximum efficiency, productivity and quality of our products.

We are currently looking for a self-motivated, data driven individual to join our finance team located in Boston, MA. The Senior Accountantâ€™s job responsibilities will entail recurring and technical accounting as well as ad hoc projects and initiatives. The Senior Accountant is primarily responsible for supporting the Controller.

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Oversee payroll, accounts payable and receivable
  • Prepare daily / weekly / monthly / quarterly reconciliations as assigned for the dispensaries and grow / processing facility
  • Analyze financial reports - trend analysis, month over month variance analyses
  • Maintain company accounting procedures and processes documents

  • Assist Controller in preparing documents and interpreting complicated financial information for managers, executives and owners
  • Contribute to financial management policies
  • Develop procedures to improve efficiency
  • Budgeting for expenses / cash balances / salaries
  • Assist with audits and taxes
  • Maintain account balances and bank statements
  • Manage general ledger and assist month-end/year-end close processes
  • Ensure compliance with all internal processes
  • Assists in preparing reporting support documentation as requested
  • Assumes additional responsibilities, as appropriate

Qualifications and Skills

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in Accounting
  • Five to seven yearsâ€™ experience, some CPA firm experience preferred
  • Good knowledge of U.S. GAAP and Tax accounting
  • Excellent and effective communication skills, both written and verbal and proofreading skills
  • Strong aptitude with Microsoft office products, specifically Excel, Word and Outlook
  • Proficiency with accounting software (SAP preferred) and experience with a POS system implementation a plus
  • Ability to solve problems and accomplish tasks with limited supervision, prioritize and multi-task
  • Ability to work quickly, accurately, and independently on a daily basis; requiring strong organizational skills, initiative and good judgment

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this position. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of the position. This job description is subject to change at any time.

We offer a competitive salary based on experience and full suite of employer assisted benefits.

Mayflower Medicinals, Inc. (Mayflower) is part of a larger, well-capitalized network of companies brought together to support best-in-class licensed cannabis cultivators, processors and dispensaries throughout the United States. We are a patient first focused organization providing top quality medical cannabis in a compassionate, warm environment. Customer Experience

Utilizes Constructive Discipline policy to ensure compliance with state and federal laws by pharmacy department personnel.

  • At least 1 year pharmacy experience including prescription filling and verification, records and legal compliance, pharmacy operations, pharmacy software and technology systems and insurance.

  • Has completed specialized training required of the State of New York's medical marijuana program.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Supervisory experience planning, organizing, and directing the work of pharmacy staff, preferably at a local specialty pharmacy.

Want to join a dynamic, growing CO2 manufacturer of raw CO2 products? Then WonderLeaf may be right for you. Find out if you are the right fit to join our team. We are seeking a self-motivated and experienced CO2 extraction technician.

We prefer you to have at least one year of CO2 extraction but if you have a lab background, a degree in a science such as Chemistry, Botany or other applicable sciences, then you may be the perfect candidate for us.

If you have the following skills and abilities, we would love to hear from you.

About WonderLeaf

WonderLeaf is a locally owned and operated recreational MIP. As a small batch, raw and uncut producer of quality cannabis concentrates and infused products, we value the relationships we build throughout the industry.

Our company was founded as a family, those of us who aren't related by blood are related by bonds of friendship. Our team is flexible and able to address all questions and issues quickly. We work hard and have fun while we do it.

Our lab team is driven by the science and art of making incredibly pure and raw products. We take great pride in what we do and we believe it shows in the final product. Tasting the WonderLeaf difference is believing.

If you want to see where science and art converge in making our products, join us in this incredible journey.

Job Description

This position is responsible for assisting in the manufacturing lab where the company produces marijuana infused products and has a multi-faceted environment, including: product extractions, research and development as well as factory settings for packaging of product for distribution.

This is a full-time position; days and hours may vary.

Benefits include paid vacations, medical and dental, paid holidays

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Preparing equipment and plant materials for extraction
  • Operating highly sophisticated extraction equipment
  • Processing concentrates and extracts
  • Cleaning and maintenance of extraction equipment and laboratory facility.
  • Ensuring the laboratory is well-stocked and resourced.
  • Recording and sometimes interpreting results to present to the Director of Laboratory Operations.
  • Using computers and performing mathematical calculations.
  • Keeping up to date with technical developments, especially those which can save time and improve reliability.
  • Conducting searches on identified topics relevant to the research.
  • Following and ensuring strict safety procedures and safety checks.
  • Maintains glassware by picking-up, cleaning, washing, sterilizing, and distributing.
  • Documentation and continued development of changing internal processes for department
  • Keeps laboratory supplies ready by inventorying stock and verifying receipt.
  • Keeps equipment operating by following operating instructions.
  • Documents information by maintaining daily logs and equipment record books.
  • Resolves problems by examining and evaluating data; selecting corrective steps.
  • Completes projects by assisting processors; attending and participating in meetings.
  • Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading technical publications.
  • Enhances laboratory and organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.
  • Prepares customer orders by fulfilling shipment requirements including the packaging and shipping of WonderLeaf products.
  • Ability to listen well and communicate effectively orally and in writing with various audiences.
  • Ability to use initiative and independent judgment appropriately.
  • Ability to interpret, understand, and comply with complex statutes, ordinances, regulations, standards, and laws.
  • Understanding of applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations as they pertain to the industry, personnel law, safety regulations, local municipal codes and organizational rules, regulations, directives and standard operating procedures.
  • Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees, management, governmental agencies, community members and the general public.
  • Must have strong communication skills with the ability to express ideas clearly and concisely in written and verbal formats.
  • Ability to use standard office equipment, computer equipment and software including word processing, data base management, METRC, spreadsheet applications and electronic mail.
  • Preparation, packaging and shipping of all WonderLeaf products.
  • Maintains active participation in at least one process improvement team.
  • Engages in regularly scheduled professional training and development activities offered by the company and others within the industry.

Company Summary:

Our client has an excellent opportunity for a Greenhouse Manager. Our newly constructed and upcoming greenhouse facilities are located on 24-acre site on the Arkansas River in the heart of the Rocky Mountains. Salida, Colorado is within the Arkansas River Headwaters RecreationalArea, surrounded by the Collegiate Peaks, and is a school district of distinction. The contemporary facility is 20K square feet of technical greenhouse, with additional 75K square feet to be substantially completed by January 2018.Our client is one of the largest cannabis flower and oil producers in Colorado, combining process manufacturing and advanced technologies.Position

Summary:

The Greenhouse Manager serves a crucial role in ensuring the greenhouse is run efficiently, effectively, and that the facility serves the production mission of our client.The Greenhouse Manager serves as the manager of the day-to-day operations of the greenhouse. We seek a highly organized, energetic, and flexible person to lead our greenhouse operations. Responsibilities include managing staff, developing policies and procedures to ensure smooth operations and to maximize efficiencies, plant cultivation and pest management, managing the control systems to maintain environmental conditions, allocation of space, managing the greenhouse budget, maintaining records, and coordinating maintenance needs with other company production units. The greenhouse must be staffed 7 days per week for plant care, requiring flexibility to work evenings, weekends, and holidays.Current permanent staffing consists of 14 FTE. The Greenhouse Manager reports to the Vice President of Operations and the Chief Executive Officer of the company.

Responsibilities:

Greenhouse Operations

  • Develop greenhouse operations plans, policies, and procedures, including plant care, health and safety operations; train and lead staff on policies and procedures.
  • Oversee, prepare and maintain plant materials used for production and research projects.
  • Implement best practices for plant health and care, paying attention to any specific cultural needs of specimens.
  • Carry out effective integrated pest control and management protocols.
  • Perform other horticultural tasks associated with the greenhouse operations.
  • Coordinate with propagation and harvest operations to optimize production of flower material.
  • Provide guidance and training to greenhouse personnel on plant cultivation, plant health care, and plant maintenance procedures.
  • Collect, analyze, and maintain data on greenhouse operations to aid strategic planning and operational decisions and activities. Communicate the information to our clientâ€™s management at least semi-annually.
  • Manage the cultivation of plants in a controlled environment.
  • Supervises and trains staff, controls inventory of plant material, creates progress reports, and ensures compliance with State and environmental safety regulations, and State regulations.

Greenhouse Facilities/Building Management

  • Supervise the operation of the greenhouse facility including the growing room temperature controls, energy curtain, blackout curtain, glazing, lighting, and watering systems.
  • Monitor climate equipment status and adjust as necessary to ensure proper functioning.
  • Coordinate maintenance needs and repairs with greenhouse staff, maintenance staff, operations management, and others as necessary.
  • Maintain inventory of all supplies and chemicals.
  • Ensure compliance with all PG environmental health and safety requirements.
  • Ensure compliance with all MED and CDA requirements.

Greenhouse Administrative Operations

  • Hire, train, and supervise staff (includes scheduling, oversight, training, and annual performance reviews).
  • Manage the greenhouse budgets and accounts. Analyze usage records to adjust cost rates as necessary. Monitor expenses and budget balances, forecast future expenses, and create budgets for the greenhouse.
  • Purchase supplies and occasional equipment for the greenhouse.

Preferred Qualifications

A masterâ€™s degree in horticulture, plant sciences, agriculture, or substantially similar field of study, and seven years or more experience as greenhouse manager.

Minimum Qualifications

A bachelorâ€™s degree in horticulture, plant sciences, or agriculture, and three years of experience in greenhouse management, OR an associateâ€™s degree in greenhouse management or the related fields of technical agricultural or floriculture, and five years of greenhouse experience, OR an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.

Always looking for any weapons or anything suspicious including non-authorized personnel trying to enter or product and materials leaving the property.

Due to the inherent needs of the cultivation facility, having flexible availability is a requirement which may include, but not limited to; working various weekday/evening and weekend shifts.

Core Duties

Packaging -

companyName: Kelan John Farrell-Smith for President in 2020
jobDescription:
Details

This job posting is aimed towards hiring unpaid (at first) interns for a 2020 United States Presidential Campaign.

Kelan John Farrell-Smith (R-CA) is a true Washington outsider, not rich or famous in any way, but is a young, 35-year-old political up-and-comer who is tired of seeing the same few (unqualified) families being promoted for political office by the media. He holds a B.A. in Psychology from California State University-Northridge, an M.S. in Clinical Psychology and an M.B.A. in International Business from California Lutheran University, as well as an M.A. in Politics from Claremont Graduate University. He is a political scholar, and is also an accomplished musician, having performed numerous classical masterworks as a member of the choir at Pomona College.

He works as a consultant.

Kelan was a longtime Democrat, having voted for Gore in 2000, Kerry in 2004, and Obama in 2008 and 2012. He supported the notion of a female President, and was a supporter of Elizabeth Warren in 2016. When it became public knowledge that the Hillary Clinton campaign had colluded with Debbie Wasserman-Schultz, former Democratic Party Chairperson, to prevent Warren and Bernie Sanders from competing with Hillary on an even playing field in the 2016 Democratic primaries, Kelan became enraged with the Democratic Party, switched parties, and ultimately voted for Donald Trump.

After watching Trump's performance in The White House for the past year (lots of controversies, firings, etc.), Kelan regrets his decision to vote for Trump, and has decided to go right at him by running as a Republican. He contemplated running as a Democrat, because he supports LGBTA+ equality, inclusion in the workplace, and the legalization of medicinal cannabis, but feels that it would be more efficient to challenge Donald Trump directly as a Republican, given the fact that many Republicans are dismayed by Donald Trump's short tenure in office.

Kelan was educated by many prominent conservative (and liberal) professors while a doctoral student at Claremont, and respects the opinions of both parties, as Americans.

Kelan's primary campaign platform is that of true campaign finance reform consisting of equal funding for all presidential candidates, because he thinks that every constitutionally eligible person should be given a chance to run for political office, not just the rich and the famous.

Currently, Mr. Farrell-Smith's campaign is seeking motivated political interns who would like to see real change in Washington, DC. He favors the idea that being educated in politics should outweigh being rich or famous, at least as far as presidential campaigns are concerned.

Job responsibilities: cold calling, polling, fundraising, etc.

Work experience: no prior political campaign experience is required

Required education: a bachelor's or master's degree in political science, politics, constitutional law, or political philosophy (political theory) is preferred, however current undergraduate college students in those fields, as well as other related fields, are encouraged to apply

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Required education:

  • High school or equivalent

our team is growing fast. We are offering a high integrity individual an opportunity to become a key member of our production team as the Laboratory Extraction Technician Slab Worker and Assistant In the Lab. Both for Overnight and Day Shift. If you are willing to work overnights please indicate that on your resume. We are looking for a person that wants to work hard. We feel very confident we can train anyone, and we do not require any previous extraction experience. However we will start someone with extraction experience with more pay. General mechanical and engineering skill or general aptitude would benefit an extract techs rate of learning and their general confidence level in the lab. However Extraction Experience even on a small home scale (if you can prove it) is worthwhile.

POSITION SUMMARY Our Laboratory Extraction Specialist will be working in the industry leading cannabis laboratory. The position is responsible for the operation and maintenance of state-of-the-art, closed-loop Butane, CO2 and Hydrocarbon extraction systems. The Laboratory Extraction Specialist will have the opportunity to work directly with our Production General Manager to create the world's finest concentrates and extracts on an industrial scale. At Oregon Genetics Companies we put our people first. You will be working around heavy machinery high pressures, low temperatures, high temperatures, and your precision is an absolute must.

Must be able to pass drug testing

.

GENERAL DUTIES * Preparing equipment and plant materials for extraction. * Operating highly sophisticated extraction equipment. * Processing concentrates and extracts * Cleaning and maintenance of extraction equipment and laboratory facility. * Maintaining strict inventory records of all plant materials, chemicals and equipment used in the laboratory. * Operating, maintaining, and making adjustments and repairs to laboratory equipment such as liquid chromatography systems, pumps, microscopes, balances, centrifuges, and other laboratory equipment * Maintaining inventory records of supplies, materials, and equipment, and preparing requisitions as needed. * Storing supplies and equipment, disposal of waste according to guidelines, and keeping laboratory, storerooms and working areas immaculate. * Washing and sterilizing laboratory glassware. * Performing clerical work related to laboratory activities such as word processing, record keeping, filing, and answering telephone inquiries. * Maintaining material safety data sheets for all department chemicals and products. * Performs related duties as assigned.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS * Be at least 21 years of age * The qualified individual will possess a keen interest and knowledge of both the Art and the Science of cannabis extraction. * Bachelor's or Associate's degree or its equivalent, from a recognized college or university, with a major in chemistry or a related field is not required, but helpful.

helpful knowledge to have:

  • Scientific methods of measurements * Health and safety practices and precautions applicable to a chemistry laboratory * Proper and safe handling and disposal of harmful chemicals, substances, and hazardous wastes * Capabilities with computer systems, software, and hardware common to laboratories * Record-keeping procedures

ABILITIES * Keep detailed and precise records * Follow complex instructions and formulae in the preparation of extracts and concentrates * Prepare chemical extracts, and dilutions to specifications * Effectively and safely operate, adapt, and maintain scientific equipment * Perform repairs and adjustments to a variety of extraction and lab equipment * Stay abreast of technical subjects, practices, and developments in the field of chemistry * Maintain an inventory of equipment, supplies, and tools * Work effectively and cooperatively with others * Write clear and concise instructions and procedures * Effectively utilize computer hardware and software * Learn general and specialized software applications

Details

FLRish, a company providing management services to the renowned Harborside Health Center medical cannabis dispensaries and building cultivation operations for vertical integration under CA state law, is seeking qualified applicants to apply for the role of Compliance Specialist .

PLEASE NOTE: All applications MUST be accompanied by a cover letter that clearly describes your interest in the medical cannabis industry. Any application received without such a cover letter will not be considered.

ABOUT US

Founded in 2015 by Steve DeAngelo, Harborside Farms cultivates medical cannabis for our Harborside dispensaries located in Oakland and San Jose. Harborside is one of the most respected and largest medical cannabis dispensaries in the United States. With over 200,000 registered patients Harborside was first in the nation to support education for seniors, veterans and families with severely ill children; the first to offer CBD-rich medicine; and the first to treat children with Dravet syndrome. Harborside continues to set an example of diversity and compliance, and is one of the prime advocates of diversity, sustainability and economic justice in the industry.

Our work is dear to our hearts, and so vital to the communities we serve. We hope all our employees find their work to be both challenging, and to carry the unique reward of knowing at the end of the day that they have done something that truly matters. We provide a competitive wage, medical, dental and vision insurance, an employer-matched 401k program, an Employee Assistance Program, FSA/Commuter Benefits, and paid time off to qualified staff members.

Harborside/ FLRish is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, present or history of mental disability, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law. EOE.

COMPLIANCE SPECIALIST

(FULL-TIME)

SUMMARY:

The Compliance Specialist assists in the development and implementation of compliance programs for the organization. Advises management on matters relating to organizational ethics and compliance. Monitors business activities for compliance with applicable rules and regulations. Ensures operating manuals and procedural documents stay current when regulations change. Assists with responding to inquiries from regulatory agencies and completes required compliance documentation.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES: (This list is not intended to be all inclusive)

  • Manages issues relating to ethics and compliance within the organization and ensures all issues are appropriately evaluated, investigated and resolved, and that confidentiality of information is maintained.
  • Conducts compliance risk assessment reviews and identifies potential areas of compliance vulnerability and risk.
  • Collaborates with business units, area offices, project sites and functions and directs ethics and compliance issues to the appropriate existing channels for investigation and resolution.
  • Develops/implements corrective action plans for resolution of problematic issues, and provides guidance for avoidance of similar issues in the future.
  • Under direction of Compliance Manager oversees the institution of an effective program for the organization to heighten awareness of ethics and compliance.
  • Regularly monitors all departments of company properties for any SOP compliance violations as well as review of video security system.
  • Follow company procedures for reporting violations and reporting said violations substantiated with documented and video evidence to Compliance Director.
  • Consults with the Compliance Director or their designee to determine whether any additional compliance training is indicated to supplement the companywide core compliance training curriculum and, if so,- Develops an appropriate supplemental compliance education plan for appropriate staff;- Maintains appropriate records to track compliance with the plan;- Provides periodic reports as needed and requested to the Compliance Director or their designee on progress against the plan; and- Periodically reviews the plan to ensure compliance with these procedure
  • Assist in the preparation and completion of an annual compliance risk assessment and develop an annual compliance review schedule.
  • Performs additional tasks and duties at the request of the Compliance Director or their designee.

PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS: (Knowledge, Skills and Abilities)

  • Advanced knowledge of POS and any other organizational inventory management system.
  • Knowledgeable in data analysis and interpretation.
  • Demonstrated passion to serve the medical cannabis community.
  • Outstanding customer relations skills.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Understanding of basic accounting principles and able to interpret financial data.
  • Intermediate math skills.
  • Advanced computer operating skills.
  • Knowledgeable in Microsoft Office Suite, with advanced knowledge in Excel.
  • Ability to work with databases and spreadsheets to create reports.

GENERAL PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS

  • Provide excellent service.
  • Present a professional image in appearance, actions and words.
  • Demonstrate ownership, accountability, initiative and quality of work.
  • Build positive team relationships throughout your department and the company.
  • Follow all safety policies
  • Be a role model for the company experience.
  • Understand and practice company values.
  • Demonstrate ethical behavior.
  • Understand & contribute to the positive culture of the organization.

Physical Requirements

  • Work is generally performed seated and requires some bending, stooping and reaching.
  • Work is generally performed in an office type setting, in a farm setting, or over the phone.
  • Work will require regular travel within California and may include limited travel outside of California.
  • Lifting up to 50 pounds.
  • Frequent contact with others via email, face-to-face discussions, and telephone.

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Typical Working Conditions

Education and Experience Required:

  • Demonstrated ability to coordinate activities with varying levels of management and staff.
  • Must exhibit excellent time-management skills by achieving departmental goals and objectives, while working in a high workload environment.
  • Understands and performs complex and detailed work with accuracy.
  • Ability to be diplomatic and persuasive in situations requiring those qualities.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently, yet function within the corporate structure.
  • Superior maturity and tact, with the ability to exercise judgment, initiative and discretion regarding confidential and sensitive matters.

  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite.

Sweet Leaf is growing and adding an Overnight Plant Work Team! This team is responsible for the efficiency and quality of the marijuana plants in all aspects for preparation of sale. The team will support the overall grow operations and assisting to run the grow overnight, while working with a team of peers in the accurate and efficient caretaking of cannabis plants in accordance to Sweet Leaf policies and procedures while maintaining a contaminate free work space.

This is an overnight position working 3-4 nights a week with shifts from 6 pm to 4 am. In order to be considered, applicants must have a industry MED Support or Key Badge.

Responsibilities include:

  • Skirting plants which requires using both hands and pruning shears to cut off lower hanging branches and pluck dead or infected leaves from the plant to promote growth and overall plant health.
  • Defoliating which requires, using hands to pull leaves off from inner parts of the plant to allow for better air flow & light penetration.
  • Tying which requires using hands while standing to tie a knot around the branch of the plant -- tie the other end of the plastic tape at a 45-degree angle to the stake above the plant.
  • Tying and staking plants including the stake, extensions, tie angle, position on branch, quantity, proper support, spending about 10-15 minutes per plant.
  • Cleaning including removing dead leaves from inside of the pot and from the floor using a broom and pan.
  • Assist with Harvest including: de-fan, top colas, plant waste, paperwork, tie removal, dumping pots, stacking stakes, cleanup.
  • Harvest hang-dry including: de-fan, wet trim, hang whole plant vs. sections, weigh plant, clean-up, 20-30 mins per plant.
  • Assist with De-Boning which includes 2 people 10 plants per hour, cut vs snap off, no shucking, timing, separation of medical and recreational.
  • Basic cleaning including sweeping an mopping of all work areas, walk-throughs, degreasing, mop with bleach.
  • Clean bathrooms including: sweeping, mopping, stocking supplies, emptying trash, cleaning the sink, and toilet of the warehouse and office.
  • Cleaning pots, trays, stakes, orange buckets including: scrubbing old roots and nutrients out thoroughly using metal brush, bleach then water dunk, stack, clean sink area, change water drum as needed, store pots.

Qualifications:

  • High school diploma or General Education Diploma (GED).
  • Excellent computer, math, language, and reasoning skills.
  • Knowledge and familiarity with Cannabis.
  • Familiarity with warehouse procedures.
  • Works in a timely manner and strives to increase productivity.
  • Experience in a complex, fast-paced environment.
  • Organization and planning skills
  • Ability to build relationships
  • Ability to handle confidential and sensitive information.
  • Basic weights and measurement skills, ability to operate a scale.
  • Must be a minimum of 21 years of age.
  • Must have a MED Support or Key Badge.

Qualified applicants please submit your resume via Indeed!

Job Description: Operations Assistant

Orewan, LLC is seeking an Operations Assistant for their facility in Salem, Oregon. This person will report to the Director of Operations for our Wana Brands infused cannabis product manufacturing facility, licensed with and operating under all rules and regulations of the State of Oregon. This person will help to develop and manage systems, processes and communications that allow the Salem facility to maintain quality production, meet production targets, and coordinate with the Colorado Wana Brands home office on all relevant matters. This person will work with the Director and with floor managers to help this 15+-person operation move through its next stage of growth. Specific duties and qualifications are listed below.

Job Duties

  • Provide coordination and communication assistance to Director of Operations. Provide support for regular staff and management meetings, coordinate calendars, facilitate communication with the Wana Brands home office, schedule travel and outside meetings, and prepare weekly priority work lists for key employees.
  • Manage systems that measure the performance of the facility. Provide reports on range of production metrics and compliance with state and local regulations. Work with production managers to ensure that all data collection and QC tasks are complete each day.
  • Work in tandem with Production Manager to help schedule production and meet production targets. Provide reports, perform analyses, generate daily dashboard (build on what our Production Manager is already preparing),
  • Oversee purchasing of materials and subsequent management of inventories. Work with Wana Brands home office purchasing/warehouse team to integrate systems where appropriate and attain assistance on other purchasing issues. Work with Inflow software to help manage inventory and purchasing needs.
  • Be point person with Wana Brand home office for communications and coordination of brand management and marketing initiatives.
  • Coordinate testing â€“ schedule deliveries of samples, pickups, record testing results.
  • Work with production management software (Filemaker Pro) to help monitor production and improve our ability to schedule and measure performance of departments.
  • Work with and support project management software (Wrike) for all projects.
  • Use data analysis software (Periscope) to generate reports for departments,
  • Coordinate hiring of new staff.
  • Oversee an assistant to run errands and handle some tasks

About Master Growers

Welcome to Master Growers Extracts.
Founded in 2014, with the primary mission of introducing people, and educating patients about the miraculous healing properties of whole plant cannabis medicine.  MG’s products have been specifically developed to help patients reduce pain and inflammation, improve the quality of their lives, and maintain a healthy existence.

The MG ACO (Alcohol Clear Oil) extraction process produces a higher quality cannabis concentrate that is easier for the body to absorb. All MG products are lab tested and certified, using only the highest quality organic ingredients. The MG ACO process preserves the natural cannabinoids, terpenes and other healthy compounds of the whole cannabis plant.  Chlorophyll and lipids are isolated and removed during the extraction process yielding a smoother product, that is easier for your  body to digest and utilize.  Our unique production method crafts an extremely safe, consistent and highly effective product.  Benefits of whole plant cannabis extract may include: reducing arthritic pain, alleviating insomnia, boosting immunity, easing symptoms of auto-immune disorders, and reducing hypertension.

Master Growers is committed to consistently delivering high quality products, while continuing to raise health awareness and creating healthy, empowered communities.

The Trim Technician trims all harvested cannabis plants to separate out the various parts of the plant based upon their value. Based upon company needs, they may perform hand-trimming either wet or dry, and they may or may not use trimming machines. Duties may also include weighing and packaging accordingly.

duties will include (but are not limited to):

Owners on all aspects of the farm, especially to aid in the regular, reliable and

ABILITIES

Must have the ability to be timely to scheduled shifts, ability to work as part of a team

and carry it 40 feet, ability to stay in a positive mind-set (even under duress).

companyName: Kelan John Farrell-Smith for President in 2020
jobDescription:
Kelan John Farrell-Smith (R-CA) is a true Washington outsider, not rich or famous in any way, but is a young, 35-year-old political up-and-comer who is tired of seeing the same few (unqualified) families being promoted for political office by the media. He holds a B.A. in Psychology from California State University-Northridge, an M.S. in Clinical Psychology and an M.B.A. in International Business from California Lutheran University, as well as an M.A. in Politics from Claremont Graduate University. He is a political scholar, and is also an accomplished musician, having performed numerous classical masterworks as a member of the choir at Pomona College. He works as a consultant.

Kelan was a longtime Democrat, having voted for Gore in 2000, Kerry in 2004, and Obama in 2008 and 2012. He supported the notion of a female President, and was a supporter of Elizabeth Warren in 2016. When it became public knowledge that the Hillary Clinton campaign had colluded with Debbie Wasserman-Schultz, former Democratic Party Chairperson, to prevent Warren and Bernie Sanders from competing with Hillary on an even playing field in the 2016 Democratic primaries, Kelan became enraged with the Democratic Party, switched parties, and ultimately voted for Donald Trump.

After watching Trump's performance in The White House for the past year (lots of controversies, firings, etc.), Kelan regrets his decision to vote for Trump, and has decided to go right at him by running as a Republican. He contemplated running as a Democrat, because he supports LGBTA+ equality, inclusion in the workplace, and the legalization of medicinal cannabis, but feels that it would be more efficient to challenge Donald Trump directly as a Republican, given the fact that many Republicans are dismayed by Donald Trump's short tenure in office.

Kelan was educated by many prominent conservative (and liberal) professors while a doctoral student at Claremont, and respects the opinions of both parties, as Americans.

Kelan's primary campaign platform is that of true campaign finance reform consisting of equal funding for all presidential candidates, because he thinks that every constitutionally eligible person should be given a chance to run for political office, not just the rich and the famous.

Currently, Mr. Farrell-Smith's campaign is seeking motivated political interns who would like to see real change in Washington, DC. He favors the idea that being educated in politics should outweigh being rich or famous, at least as far as presidential campaigns are concerned.

Job responsibilities: cold calling, polling, fundraising, etc.

Work experience: no prior political campaign experience is required

Required education: a bachelor's or master's degree in political science, politics, constitutional law, or political philosophy (political theory) is preferred, however current undergraduate college students in those fields, as well as other related fields, are encouraged to apply

Required education:

  • Master's

Job Description

The Nursery Assistant is responsible for assisting with the daily operation of the Walden Nursery. This individual performs all aspects of running both a retail and production nursery including: coordinating and supervising the activities of the Walden Nursery Crew; plant propagation and care; inventorying nursery stock, hard goods and supplies; and maintenance of nursery facilities. Must communicate well and maintain good public relations with employees and staff. This is a 40-hour per week, non-exempt position that reports to the Horticulture Scientist/Director.

Essential Functions:

Stock plant care - assists with watering, fertilizing, pest management, pruning, weeding, preparing soil media and grooming of stock plants are performed accurately and according to daily and seasonal schedule. Maintains general care of horticultural tools and technical equipment. Keeps the Nursery facilities clean and tidy at all times.

Plant Production â€“ oversees propagation of plants for production and sale including: collecting cuttings from stock plants, sowing seed, processing cuttings, fertilization, environmental monitoring, and transplanting. Keeps records and ensures that plant propagation and production processes stay on schedule and produces plants of the highest quality. Maintains the appropriate growing environment and nursery equipment.

Labeling and Inventory - maintains inventory of plants and essential nursery supplies; prints plant label tags as required and ensures that all plants are accurately labeled. Ensures State traceability requirements are maintained.

Coordinates Nursery Crew - supervise daily teams of employees and direct their activities; coordinate annual training program for new recruits; provides ongoing training.

Knowledge and abilities:

Basic knowledge of horticultural requirements of Cannabis and/or annual plants grown in soilless media. Knowledge of both retail and production nursery operations and relevant equipment. Knowledge of vegetative plant propagation techniques and general knowledge of plant care. Ability to run various computer programs/apps including Office, Google, and email. Ability to think critically and exercise independent judgment and initiative. Able to work under pressure and meet deadlines while maintaining equanimity. Ability to interact well with others and cooperate in a team environment. Ability to communicate well in English, both verbally and in writing. Spanish language proficiency is a bonus.

Minimum qualifications:

Associate degree in Horticulture or related field OR minimum of two years professional experience in plant propagation and nursery care. Experience with Cannabis propagation and cultivation not essential. Good organizational and interpersonal skills; some supervisory experience highly desirable.

Certificates and Licenses:

Must have valid driver's license and maintain acceptable driving record.

Must pass background check

Physical requirements:

Ability to stand/walk for extended periods of time, lift and carry 50 lbs, bend, squat and walk. Tolerance to indoor and outdoor environmental conditions, including extreme temperature fluctuations, rain, dust, wildfire smoke, allergens, insects, and sun exposure. Ability to perform physically strenuous work assignments. Availability to work weekend shifts as needed.

LoudPack Farms is currently expanding into all reputable markets. The company is hiring an Procurement Specialist to work in our new state-of-the-art 40,000 sq. ft. cultivation and processing center located in Monterey County, CA.

Responsibilities and Duties

The Procurement Specialist will perform a wide variety of buying and purchasing activities. Purchase supplies, services, equipment in the required quantity and quality; request for quotations; and to perform related work. Responsible for the complex and difficult purchasing duties; develop procurement strategies and documents, and negotiating fixed-price and cost-type contracts for services.

  • Coordinates specification preparation, and secures bids/proposals. Develops and maintains bidders' lists
  • Solicits quotations and bids; negotiates prices, terms and contracts. Selects suppliers from bidders' lists
  • Serves as advisor to subordinate buyers on unusual or difficult policy problems
  • Participates in hiring of staff; consults with user department personnel concerning requirements
  • Recommends review of revised purchasing procedures; serves on other purchasing related committees
  • May supervise and train subordinate staff, including evaluation and discipline
  • Advises user department representatives on purchase methods and alternate products and may recommend substitutes
  • Resolves discrepancies and invoice problems; corresponds and communicates with suppliers and departments regarding services and complaints
  • Prepares bids and requests for quotations, including required special terms and conditions, performance, and technical criteria
  • Recommends new or revised purchasing procedures
  • Provides responsive, high quality service by providing accurate, complete and up-to-date information, in a courteous, efficient and timely manner

Qualifications and Skills

  • Principles of employee supervision and training; general business practices and procedures
  • Accounting principles, material management systems
  • Contracting law, Uniform Commercial Code, and other laws and regulations pertaining to the solicitation of bids/proposals, evaluation of offers, negotiations and awarding of contracts; read, interpret and explain laws, rules and office policies and procedures
  • Current technology and trends in the profession; supervise, train, and evaluate subordinates
  • Perform cost and price analysis, negotiate business agreements; compile data for purposes of bidding and awarding contracts
  • Organize and prioritize unit workload to meet deadlines and operating needs
  • Use electronic purchasing systems, modern office equipment and software
  • Perform basic math; use and calculate measuring units
  • Prepare written records and complete logs; file records alphabetically and numerically
  • Effectively communicate orally and in writing; follow written and oral instructions; telephone, office, and on-line etiquette
  • Ensures compliance with State regulations and testing requirements; stays current with practices and new developments in the cannabis industry; understanding of state and local laws
  • Understanding of proper and safe handling of hazardous materials
  • Must at least 21 years old per state regulations and successfully pass a background and drug screening (excluding cannabis)

DESIRED ATTRIBUTES

  • Logical Thinker: Takes a step-by-step approach to analyze information and solve problems
  • Detail Oriented: Pays close attention to all the little details, and there are many
  • Trustworthy: Known for personal integrity and honesty

Do you have what it takes to be a part of an industry leading cannabis company? We are GrowHealthy â€“ a company dedicated to delivering the best products and services possible to the patients of Florida.

GrowHealthy Holdings, LLC and its family of companies are positioned to become one of Floridaâ€™s largest and most trusted chains of medical marijuana companies. Working hand-in-hand with state & local governments, the GrowHealthy brand features company-grown, tested, safe and effective medical marijuana products.

We are looking for an experienced Controller with 5 â€“ 10 years experience, preferably some of that in public accounting. The ideal candidate will have worked at a start up and is able to create structure around the accounting function. They should have strong management experience and be willing to lead by example. They will work closely with GrowHealthyâ€™s parent company, iAnthus Capital â€“ a publicly traded Canadian company (IAN). This position reports to the Chief Financial Officer of GrowHealthy and works in partnership with the senior management team to ensure consistent and accurate reporting of all financials. Total compensation will include variable performance pay in addition to a market competitive base and benefits package.

Responsibilities and Duties

OVERVIEW

The Financial Controller is responsible for day-to-day accounting/finance functions. This position addresses tight deadlines and a multitude of accounting activities including oversight of payments, general ledger preparation, meeting regulatory deadlines, and coordination with external auditors. The Financial Controller will work closely with the company's Chief Financial Officer and the public parent companyâ€™s accounting team.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Effectively and efficiently manage all day-to-day accounting functions including A/P, A/R, payroll
  • Maintain general ledgers and trial balances, ensuring that monthly, quarterly and annual reporting requirements are met according to pre-determined timelines.

  • Maintain banking relationships, coordinate payments for all vendors, manage cash requirements and liquidity, perform monthly bank reconciliations for bank accounts
  • Ensure all compliance requirements are met - timely filing of all tax returns and regulatory filings
  • Prepare and coordinate supporting documents files for external audit of company
  • Interpret output from POS system and translate into financial information
  • Respond to inquiries from CEO, CFO, COO, and parent company team regarding financial results
  • Design and implement accounting controls. Monitor and analyze department work to develop more efficient procedures and use of resources while maintaining a high level of accuracy.
  • Support team with special projects and workflow process improvements.
  • Assist with building out of accounting team as required
  • Perform other duties as assigned by the senior management team

Qualifications and Skills

  • Bachelors degree from an accredited school along with a CPA
  • 5 -10 years of experience in financial operations/controllership related role
  • Knowledge of accepted accounting principles, requirements and practices (GAAP). IFRS experience an asset
  • Experienced in a high volume, high transaction setting
  • Strong Microsoft Office skillset and advanced usage of Excel
  • Experience with QuickBooks (or similar bookkeeping software) and experience with payroll systems
  • Must be able to thrive in a fast-paced setting. Highly efficient at completing tasks in an organized and timely manner. Ability to multi-task, work under pressure and meet deadlines is required
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to work in a team environment and have strong interpersonal skills required
  • Experience in cannabis or agriculture preferred

jobTitle: Massage Therapist, Esthetician, Acupuncturist, or Holistic Practitioner
jobDescription:
Job Summary

Welcome!

This is Jessika Mankin, LMT of Soothing Therapeutic Massage. I have 2 rooms in a beautiful office in Midtown Fort Collins and I am looking for 1 or 2 holistic health practitioners to join me in my busy practice. I am open to Massage Therapists, Estheticians, Acupuncturists, Chiropractors, Yoga Therapist or other Holistic Health Professionals. Depending on how many clients you already have and how integrated you want to be with my business, you would have the option of being an independent contractor with an hourly room rent or a full employee. Either way, you would be joining me under the umbrella of Soothing Therapeutic Massage and will be included on my website and online scheduler with exposure to my 1100+ client base.

I have 12 years of experience and over 1000 hours of training from schools in Austin and San Diego. My style is very thorough and different from others in the area. I blend a relaxing circulatory massage with deep tissue sculpting, Asian modalities, gentle stretching and energy work. I also have an in-depth knowledge of nutrition, various holistic modalities and a yoga teacher training certification. I was lucky to have many wonderful teachers and I would love to pass on what I have learned to others.Massage therapists that join my practice, we can meet regularly to exchange ideas and techniques with each other, creating a sense of community.

Ideal candidates:

- Genuinely enjoy helping people- Have a passion for learning about the human body and how to help it.- Are dependable, hardworking and honest

- Enjoy working with a small group of like-minded MT's in a non-corporate environment.- Are licensed and insured in Colorado.

- Have a friendly, positive attitude and high standards for professionalism and hygiene.- Are interested in holistic health, nutrition, and energy work.

- Feel comfortable working with CBD (Cannabis) lotion (if you are a massage therapist). It doesn't contain THC or get you high, and it has wonderful health benefits!

- It's a bonus if you can perform hot stone massages, since I bought a brand new kit and stones!

If you are interested, please tell me about yourself, your experience, if you currently have clients, and what your ideal schedule would be.

Sat, Sun, Mon, Tues, and Wed are available all day and the remaining days of the week are available before 1pm.

I look forward to hearing from you!

Jessika Mankin, LMT

Soothing Therapeutic Massage

www.soothingtm.com

The top cannabis oil producer in the state is looking for a passionate and professional individual to fill the role of Laboratory Technician. We are looking for an individual who will be working with a variety of Laboratory/production tasks. This individual must be able to multi-task, work quickly and efficiently, and be adaptable to change priorities and tasks as needed. We have a very fast- paced environment as we continue to grow and expand. Must be motivated, trustworthy, and a team player.

Laboratory Technician Job Responsibilities:

Carry out laboratory production; intake raw material; enter and track material quantities in CTS system; create batch records a given process; troubleshooting and resolving problems; maintaining logs and record books; maintaining glassware; daily lab cleanup.

Laboratory Technician Job Duties:

  • Follow Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
  • Intake and Process raw cannabis material into a crude concentrate.
  • Document information by creating and maintaining accurate batch records.
  • Secondary cannabinoid processing; prepare cannabinoid concentrate for specific secondary refining processes.
  • Carry out cannabinoid concentrate refining processes to completion with clear and well defined labeling to ensure absolute traceability throughout the process.
  • Navigate Cannabis Tracking System (CTS) and execute common commands for a given project.
  • Keep equipment operational by following operating instructions; troubleshooting breakdowns; performing preventive maintenance.
  • Keep laboratory inventorying in stock; placing orders; verifying receipt.
  • Resolves problems by examining and evaluating data; selecting corrective steps.
  • Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading technical publications.
  • Enhances laboratory and organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.
  • Maintains glassware by picking-up, cleaning, washing, sterilizing, and organizing.

Laboratory Technician Skills and Qualifications:

Chemistry Techniques, Lab Environment, Solvent Extraction, Cannabis Knowledge, Chemical Properties of Cannabinoids, Cryogenic Procedures, Record Keeping, Data Tracking, Safe Lab Practices, Equipment Calibration and Maintenance, Chemical Safety, Supply Management, Self-Development

COMPENSATION

  • Depending on experience.

Medical, Dental, Vision benefits are provided. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Position Summary:

The Technical Director reports to the Company President, and is responsible for the daily operations and project management needs of the Sensi Scientific (Medical Cannabis) Division of R.I. Analytical while also adhering to the quality system.

The Technical Director assigns tasks, provides operational support to departmental staff, reviews and approves data, coordinates completion of QA/QC tasks, and actively participates in the daily laboratory production of the Division with oversight from the President. Operational support includes, but is not limited to: method development; handling of special projects; scheduling of work tasks based on priority status, hold times and due dates; resolution of issues encountered during daily production; maintenance and upkeep of relevant equipment and instrumentation; ordering of necessary supplies and inventory control. This position requires the active participation in the training and oversight of departmental staff, thereby ensuring compliance with the quality system, facility security and laboratory standard operating procedures, health & safety regulations, as well as company policies.

Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Directs, researches, investigates, and implements the best approaches for all aspects of laboratory operations and management in order to ensure on time delivery of analytical data to internal and external clients while maintaining a reputation for excellence and providing complete client satisfaction
  • Effectively manages workload to ensure that any hold times and all requested turnarounds are met. When necessary, alerts the President of an inability to meet turnaround times. As projects may warrant, arranges for after hours, weekend and holiday laboratory coverage
  • Ensures that the laboratory has the necessary resources (e.g. laboratory space, personnel, consumable supplies, and equipment) to perform the work of the Division
  • Serves as the primary person responsible for ensuring adherence to the requirements of all certifications and accreditations held by the Division
  • Reinforces the established quality system (quality of data and adherence to written policies and procedures), employee handbook policies, and seeks out areas for improvement within laboratory operations applying principles of continuous improvement
  • Provides yearly review of department SOPs, and schedules other QA/QC related functions within the laboratory such as MDL studies, proficiency testing and the implementation of all corrective and/or preventative actions identified in a timely manner
  • Is available during all hours for consultation with personnel in order to provide direction with regard to technical questions
  • Oversees the hiring, training, supervision, and annual performance evaluation of all applicable laboratory personnel
  • Performs a final review and approves all analytical data produced by the laboratory prior to reporting, in collaboration with the Data Reporting Manager. In certain situations has full authority to review and approve final reports directly
  • Drafts, reviews and accepts laboratory Standard Operating Procedures in conjunction with the Quality Assurance Officer
  • Maintains the Statement of Qualifications and completes the annual Management Review in accordance to ISO 17025 requirements
  • Resolves Corrective Actions with the QA/QC Officer and proposes Preventive Actions
  • Performs method development and validations according to all quality system requirements
  • Stays current with the latest industry developments and market trends; is familiar with what the competition is doing
  • Seeks approval for all laboratory capital expenditures above $500
  • Performs other duties as required or assigned by the President and Vice President.

Qualifications:

Education: Minimum Bachelor's degree (B.S.) in chemistry or related field

Experience: Minimum 5 years of experience in the laboratory analysis of samples

Strong organizational, project management and communication skills

Ability to recognize areas of improvement and implement effective solutions

Overview

We are looking for a well-rounded WordPress Developer that is comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment and has extensive experience in troubleshooting software issues within WordPress.  The position will start out as a part-time freelance role with the potential to grow into a full-time salaried position if you prove to be a good fit for our team.  You will report directly to the CEO of Trim.

We would prefer someone that is local to the Denver/Boulder metro area, but will consider remote work outside of Denver for the right candidate.

Your initial task will be to support our clients websites for any software issues that might arise.

About You:

You can provide the highest level of customer support.  You WILL occasionally interact with clients. (Bonus points if you have read “Delivering Happiness” by Tony Hsieh)

You don’t just do enough to get by.  We want to hear your input and expertise!  If you think you can improve our process or work flow.. speak up!

You work well in a collaborative creative environment and don’t hide under your hoodie in the corner all day.

We love what we do and the space that we work in!  Because of that we tend to work a lot of crazy hours, have a lot of fun, and can sometimes forget we are at work.  If you are looking for a traditional 9 – 5 environment we are not going to be a good fit for each other.

TITLE: Packaging and Logistics Manager

Integrative Health Products, LLC., is a product development company. We license innovative products to legal, state-licensed manufacturers in the medical and recreational cannabis industry in order to maximize clients' market share, brand awareness, and consumer education.

Job Summary

The Packaging and Logistics Manager facilitates all supply chain logistics, including packaging, labels, ingredients, and any other necessary purchases for official IHP Licensees. Additionally, the PLM will work with the product development manager to help acquire new packaging and manage new and existing vendor relationships in order to secure better deals for our clients.

This job will require the qualified candidate to be able to read, interpret, and actualize work product compliant with state regulations which may vary from licensee to licensee, manage complete supply chains, and meet the needs of all clients in terms of logistical coordination between vendors and licensees. Additionally, the qualified candidate will be well versed in using communications tools and driving decision making through data analysis.

Job Responsibilities:

1. Source packaging at the direction of the product development manager for new products in the pipeline;

2. Re-order and maintain supplies of all ingredients, packaging, and supplies for IHP licensees as required by the licensee;

3. Manage relationships with all new and existing packaging vendors, including placing orders, negotiating pricing, and managing ship dates to meet deadlines;

4. Understand and act on all state specific packaging requirements for relevant state regulations and work with regulators where necessary to expand;

5. Acquire or generate dielines for packaging to send to graphics team and implement graphics designs with 3rd party label and/or packaging manufacturers;

6. Constantly search for new vendors and remain on the cutting edge of cannabis packaging developments in order to improve style and efficiency of IHP products, bringing new packaging ideas to the developers for discussion;

7. Evaluate costs of all regularly-replenished items, including not only packaging, but other commonly-used production inputs (e.g., nutrients, uniforms, tools) and overhead expenses (e.g., insurance). Identify and pursue cost-saving opportunities.

Candidate Requirements:

  • Have previous experience in cost analysis and navigating vendor relationships;
  • Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities concurrently with shifting priorities
  • Ability to be a team player as well as work independently
  • Ability to work with all levels of Management
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills including proficiency in Microsoft Office or GSuite
  • Cannabis experience not required

The applicant must be flexible, professional, highly motivated, and able to manage multiple responsibilities and staff and complete tasks efficiently with a high degree of accuracy. This is a paid, full-time position working 8 hour shifts Monday through Friday. Compensation and benefits will be determined based on level of qualifications and experience.

jobTitle: Senior Systems and Software Quality Assurance Analyst
jobDescription:
Job Summary

The Information Technology Services Division (ITSD) of the Washington State Liquor and Cannabis Board (WSLCB) is a fast-paced, quickly adapting part of our business and is integral in finding, implementing and maintaining systems for our agency. At this time, the ITSD is announcing an exciting opportunity for up to two Senior Systems and Software Quality Assurance Analyst (ITS4). These positions elicit business and technical requirements, provide senior system analysis services, and execute functional and non-functional quality assurance activities. In addition, these positions plan work and facilitate business engagement in project activities as well as design and follow requirement and documentation standards to elicit business, functional and technical requirements, design technical solutions, and maintain system documentation that supports application development, configuration, and testing. As the Senior Systems and Software Quality Assurance Analyst, you will establish and maintain technical and architectural documentation standards and mentor and provide leadership to technical resources conducting systems analysis. You will be responsible for working with other application systems analysts and software quality assurance engineers to ensure that work is coordinated and meets project, department and industry standards.

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Elicit and manage requirements for complex solution
  • Elicit functional (business) requirements from internal and external subject matter experts for WSLCB lines of business
  • Elicit non-functional (technical) requirements from WSLCB subject matter experts
  • Serve as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical staff to ensure business needs are clearly defined, understood and translated into technical solutions; conversely, ensure that technical requirements are translated into solution opportunities or constraints for business stakeholders
  • Plan, execute, coordinate and analyze project software quality assurance activities
  • Analyze functional and non-functional requirements for completeness and testability
  • Define, develop and execute manual and automated test cases
  • Define testing strategies for approved acceptance criteria
  • Review test results to confirm that test acceptance criteria has been met
  • Provide consultation to project stakeholders

Qualifications and Skills

Required Qualifications

  • Working level knowledge of requirements elicitation and documentation.
  • Working level knowledge of business analysis planning.
  • Working level technical analytical skills with proven documentation of analysis and recommendation.
  • Working level technical writing skills necessary to create and maintain user requirements and system documentation.
  • Working level knowledge of iterative development techniques, such as Agile.
  • Working level knowledge of test planning.
  • Working level writing skills in test case writing and test execution.
  • Expert workload management skills.
  • Expert presentation, interpersonal, written and oral communication skills when communicating to internal IT personnel as well as users in the business units.

Preferred/Desired Qualifications

  • Working level knowledge of writing and modifying Structure Query Language (SQL) statements.
  • A valid Certification of Competency in Business Analysis (CCBA) or Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) Certification.
  • Experience with Visual Studio Team Services (VSTS) or Team Services Foundation (TFS).
  • An Associate's degree or completion of an accredited vocational training program in an information technology or related program in information technology analysis, system maintenance, or troubleshooting/problem resolution experience, or analyzing, designing, or programming computer systems applications or databases.

OR

  • 3 years of demonstrated experience of information technology experience such as consulting, analyzing, designing, programming, installing, and/or maintaining computer software applications, hardware, telecommunications, or network infrastructure equipment, directing projects, providing customer or technical support in information technology; or administering or supervising staff that performed work in any of these information technology disciplines.

DISPENSARY FRONT OFFICE COORDINATOR

Sonoma Patient Group is currently recruiting for a full-time, experienced professional to provide reception services and administrative assistance in a fully permitted cannabis dispensary centrally located in Santa Rosa. We are seeking an enthusiastic, motivated individual to be the primary point of contact for patients, visitors and vendors. The front office position requires a professional demeanor and has the primary responsibility of coordinating patient reception, clerical and administrative support, and ensuring that services are provided in an effective and efficient manner. The position includes greeting patients, patient in-take, medical records input and filing. The successful candidate is personable, well-groomed and knowledgeable about medical front office practices, privacy and HIPPA regulations and the cannabis industry. This position also provides support to the Patient Consultants and Managers. The position will be trained by dispensary management and may attend other formal dispensary seminars or schooling. Bi-lingual Spanish/English skills are not required but are highly valued.

This recruitment is limited to applicants with a minimum of two (2) years of experience in a professional office or pharmacy environment. Vocational education is valued but may not be substituted for actual on-the-job experience. The successful candidate must have up-to-date intermediate computer skills using Microsoft Office and ability to quickly gain competency in other industry specific applications. Current regulations require that dispensary employees must be age 21 years or older with a current Medical Cannabis recommendation. Prompt and regular attendance is essential. A high degree of initiative and self-motivation is required together with integrity, honesty, dependability and stability for working within a dynamic environment. The starting wage $15 per hour; a full-time position is offered; however, part-time options may be discussed. Employees working more than 30 hours per week are eligible for a generous employee benefit package.

Interviews are by invitation only; no walk-in interviews are available.

Representative Skills and Duties: This is an extremely busy office location and requires a strong ability to multi-task. The Front Desk Coordinator will provide professional and courteous information to patients and vendors; provide exceptional customer care by promoting and maintaining positive customer relations; maintain knowledge of and closely follow front office procedures; answer and direct incoming phone calls; greet patients and visitors and provide clear direction with the utmost discretion. This individual must facilitate the flow of the front desk incorporating patient accommodation and office productivity; collect new patient information; create, process and maintain patient files; organize, prepare and submit data and reports as directed and maintain and manage current resource materials for the public. In addition, the Front Office Coordinator promotes upcoming events and patient appreciation days and supports event staff as needed, including data entry and word processing.

Job Summary

BE A PART OF THE NOA TEAM!

PRODUCT SPECIALIST

POSITION SUMMARY

A Noa Botanicals Product Specialist is responsible for patient and caregiver intake, product transactions, and providing excellent customer service to a variety of audiences. The Product Specialist must maintain a thorough understanding of medical marijuana varieties, derivatives and infused products based on current offerings in the Hawaii market and current cannabis science. The Product Specialist must provide superior customer service and educational guidance to registered patients and caregivers. The Product Specialist must maintain a professional appearance, organized work environment and dispensary appearance. The Product Specialist reports directly to the Dispensary Assistant Manager.

This position is open to local applicants only and is not eligible for relocation assistance.

Responsibilities and Duties

CORE JOB DUTIES (includes but not limited to)

Customer Service and Record-Keeping:

  • Greet patients and caregivers as they enter the dispensary. Provide exceptional service for new and returning patients, answer any questions they may have, and provide orientations and tours when needed;
  • Obtain the appropriate documentation from each patient and caregiver at every visit, ensuring validity of his or her identification and registration with the State;
  • Record each visit using the patient management software, ensuring accuracy of customer and caregiver information, and recording notes if necessary;
  • Observe and maintain all applicable patient confidentiality requirements;
  • Communicate with management to maintain a steady customer traffic flow to maximize sales and customer satisfaction;
  • Respond to and resolve customer requests, complaints, or compliments in person, through email, and on the phone, escalating for supervisor support as needed; and
  • Maintain organization of records, desk space, dispensary and waiting room through daily upkeep and light cleaning.

Medical Marijuana Education and Guidance:

  • Maintain knowledge of all applicable state and local laws, all medicine, products and services provided, as well as documentation processes in accordance with the State of Hawaii;
  • Maintain a basic understanding of the medicine, products and services provided at Noa Botanicals;
  • Educate patients and caregivers on medicating options and methods, strain information, medicine effectiveness for specific ailments and cultivation methods;
  • Record specific requests, preferences, and notes concerning customer and caregiver registration status using the patient management software; and
  • Maintain awareness of customer input and suggest changes to improve service or product.

Processing Transactions:

  • Collect payment and process transactions after order verification;
  • Apply transaction amount to each customerâ€™s allocated amount in accordance with state and local law;
  • Prepare and build patient and caregiver online and pre-orders.
  • Provide receipt for each transaction.

Documentation:

  • Prepare documents as needed to assist customersâ€™ intake and registration within our dispensary; and
  • Ensure accurate information is recorded for all patient and caregiver registration, sales and preferences; and follows all guidelines issued by the State.
  • Communicate inventory levels with Assistant Manager and Dispensary Manager to maintain accurate menus and update menus as needed; and coordinate with the COO as needed.

Additional Duties as Required.

  • May include harvesting, processing, and/or packaging of medical cannabis product.

Qualifications and Skills

CORE COMPETENCIES

  • Knowledge of State of Hawaii laws, regulations and rules related to medical marijuana.
  • BioTrack and/or previous sales experience preferred.
  • Accurate data-entry and record keeping.
  • Desire to learn about our products
  • Ability to answer multi-phone line system.
  • Strong attention to detail, organizational skills and time management abilities.
  • Superior communication and customer service skills: Must be positive and welcoming.
  • Proficiency and accuracy in using windows-based software, POS software, and internet navigation.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, changing and challenging environment.

EDUCATION AND BACKGROUND REQUIREMENTS

  • Must be and remain compliant with any and all legal or company regulations for working in the cannabis industry.
  • High School Diploma or GED required.
  • Minimum of 21 years of age as required by state statute.
  • Must pass state and federal criminal and fingerprint background checks, per applicable requirements set forth under state statute.

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS

  • Must have reliable transportation; flexibility in scheduling.
  • This job function may include walking or standing for extended periods of time, as well as stooping, bending over and/or crouching. Must be able to lift, carry and balance up to 30 pounds (100 pounds with assistance).

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY AND AFFIRMATIVE ACTION

We are an equal opportunity employer and strives to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and staff in accordance with sound employee relations practices and federal and state laws. Noa Botanicals is also firmly committed to taking affirmative action to employ qualified individuals with disabilities, veterans with disabilities, veterans, minorities, and women and to advance them in employment. If you are an individual with a disability and require accommodation during the application process, please contact our HR Department at 808-800-2126.

Feel Good Sales Group (FGSG) is looking for regional sales reps across California. Applicants should be experienced in sales, entrepreneurial minded, highly motivated, reliable and passionate about cannabis.

About FGSG:

A more comprehensive and professional sales solution for cannabis brands.

Position Summary:

While this industry is super freakinâ€™ cool, exciting and booming with opportunity, it is a lot more challenging and dynamic than you would expect. The reality of being an outside sales rep is extremely demanding. Dealing with often unorganized, unreliable and unprofessional people can be frustrating and this industry is full of them. Most buyers at dispensaries are difficult to find and get a hold of. Dispensaries will strategically keep outsiders from knowing who the buyer is.

To be successful, you will need to be resilient, tenacious, organized and cool-as-a-fan. Suits and squares donâ€™t get far in this industry, but neither do unprofessional stoners.

As a FGSG sales rep you will be representing some of the most reputable cannabis brands to dispensaries and deliveries. You will work with other bright, healthy hustlers like yourself, under supportive management. Your job will be to maximize sales in your territory by opening, servicing and managing accounts, cultivating meaningful relationships, providing superior service and support, promotions, inventory management, merchandising and weekly reporting.

This is an extremely unique opportunity to get into the cannabis industry with a good company.

  • Increase brand and product awareness
  • Educate patients about our brandsâ€™ products
  • Encourage trial of products through sampling
  • Driving sales through promotional offers
  • Push awareness of events through social media
  • Inventory Management â€“ Stay diligently on top of inventory to maximize sales.
  • Merchandising â€“ Ensure that our brandsâ€™ products are optimally positioned and merchandised with display units, POP and collateral.

Perks

  • Be part of a fun, successful, synergetic and rewarding team of awesome people
