Job Summary: Section Growers will work under the direction of the Head Grower to perform all growing tasks necessary to produce and maintain crops that consistently meet the standards of Schmidt Bros. Inc.

Section Growers report directly to Head Grower

Section Grower responsibilities and functions:

  • Perform all aspects of growing including watering, fertilization, spraying and testing using grow plan as a guideline
  • Monitor and maintain proper greenhouse environment per crop protocol
  • Identify, track and control disease and pest related issues using IPM practices
  • Place, monitor and replace sticky cards on a regular basis.
  • Place and keep current growing activity tags in each crop
  • Using reports, as determined by management, monitor crop timing and alert management of deviations in expected crop ready date
  • Ã‚ Mix and apply pesticides and PGRs as per label and written grow plan. All such applications must be in compliance with the WPS including pre application posting, sign placement (and timely removal after REI has expired), proper PPE, etc.
  • Maintain written records as directed by Head Grower.
  • Manage assistant grower(s) in performing growing tasks
  • Manage non growing personnel, as assigned by management, in performing plant maintenance tasks (i.e. pinching, spacing, etc.)
  • Communicate with the head grower any crop concerns such as disease or insect problems, plant maintenance needs, etc.
  • Communicate with and assist other section growers as needed
  • Maintain a neat and orderly work area
  • All other duties as assigned

Skills/Qualifications

  • Horticultural or related degree is a plus
  • Ability to stand, climb, squat, twist or bend for long periods of time
  • Must be able to work in extreme greenhouse environments
  • Must be able to work long, flexible hours in peak season with weekends required
  • Must be able to follow both verbal and written instructions
  • Must possess adequate math skills to calculate fertilizer and pesticide rates.
  • Must be reliable and maintain a good attendance record

Job Type: Full-time

Job Summary

Sun Valley Alternative Health Centers is currently searching for an experienced bookkeeper with Quickbooks expertise and immediate availability for a full-time bookkeeper. Sun Valley has 7 accounts that need maintenance. Your responsibilities will include:

-all journal entries into Quickbooks

-monthly bank reconciliations

-weekly credit card reconciliations

-daily cash deposit reconciliations

-inter-company payment transfers and proper balance sheet entries

-report generation

-tax prep-communication and assistance to CPA for tax filing

-communication and assistance to CPA for yearly audits for our Franchise LLC

-communication and assistance to CPA for yearly audits of four of our LLCs that are partially owned by a publicly traded company

This position requires a skilled and experienced professional willing to work directly with the COO. You will have your own dedicated desk space in our Surprise clinic located at 12801 W Bell Rd, but there will be days required to work with the COO in her home office. If you have allergies or concerns regarding dogs and cats, this is not the position for you -- our home office is often visited by the COO's family, including the pets and baby daughter. Additionally, please be aware that our business is adjacent to the cannabis industry. We are not a dispensary, we do not sell, grow, or distribute cannabis -- we are simply the doctors that provide consultations to patients seeking a state approved Medical Marijuana Certification. We are fully legal on both a state and federal level and have no legal conflicts regarding our taxes or services. To learn more about our organization visit our website at www.svmmjcc.com .

PTO, health insurance and 401K benefits are available after 60 days. If you are interested and have the availability and skills described above, please contact us through this ad, send your resume, salary requirements, and an explanation of your experience. References will be checked -- please be prepared to provide them. We are eager to welcome you to our team!

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $16.00 to $22.00 /hour

Required experience:

  • QuickBooks: 1 year
  • Bookkeeping: 1 year

Overview

We are a licensed Medical Cannabis Co. operating since 2012 in the West Valley. We are seeking a Marketing Manager to be responsible for developing, implementing and executing strategic marketing plans for our entire organization (or lines of business and brands within the organization) in order to attract potential patients and retain existing ones.

Day-to-day tasks include managing and coordinating outside marketing and creative staff, leading market research efforts to uncover the viability of current and existing products/services, and liaising with media organizations and advertising agencies.

The Marketing Manager’s skill set includes
Leader & Self Starter
Create Marketing campaign & initiatives
Outdoor Media Management
Social Media Management
In Store Advertising
Intimate understanding of traditional and emerging marketing channels
Excellent communication skills
Ability to think creatively and innovatively
Budget-management skills and proficiency
Professional judgment and discretion that comes from years of experience in the field
Analytical skills to forecast and identify trends and challenges
Familiarity with the latest trends, technologies, and methodologies in graphic design, web design, production, etc.

Daily tasks and duties include:

Daily posting on all Social Media sites
Monitoring and analyzing market trends
Studying competitors’ products and services
Exploring ways of improving existing products and services, and increasing profitability
Identifying target markets and developing strategies to communicate with them
Preparing and managing marketing plans and budgets
Managing the production of promotional material
Liaising with other internal departments such as sales and distribution
Producing reports to monitor results
Presenting findings and suggestions to company directors or other senior managers
Traveling to trade shows, conferences and sales meetings
Supporting and managing a marketing team

Education and Experience
A formal education in a related field and a minimum of 5 years experience is required.

How To Apply:
If you feel that you meet the qualification and are interested in applying, respond to this posting with the following information. All qualified candidates will receive a response BUT we will NOT respond if you do not provide the following:

1) Cover Letter
2) Resume or CV
3) Photo
4) Salary Requirements

Tagged as: digital marketing, marketing, sales, social media, trade shows

jobTitle: Trimmer for Cultivation Operation Marijuana Dispensary
jobDescription:
Job Summary

Medical Marijuana Grow facility seeking a FULL-TIME EXPERIENCED TRIMMER & PACKAGER

(1) Packaging Department: Full time (32-40 hours available, 5 days a week) $10-$12/hr starting wage. Duties include pre-packaging our bud into containers for our recreational customers, rolling joints, entering data into POS system, printing labels, organizing buds and concentrates.

(2) Trimmer: Full time (32-40 hours available, 5 days a week) $10-$12/hr starting wage. Trimmer: Work at our trim table with a team of full-timers by your side. Great atmosphere and people. Start at hourly rate go up quickly with a great work ethic, diligence, good attendance, and get to salary rates! We will pay for truly experienced individuals and can provide FULL-TIME hours Monday-Friday. If you are inexperienced we MAY be willing to teach you - but you'll have to have the right work ethic, capability, and willingness to learn!

When you apply PLEASE DETAIL YOUR EXPERIENCE. For example: How many hours you have trimmed, how many cycles, wet or dry or both. etc., Have you ever used Metrc, do you have any packaging experience, etc. We are hiring for these positions ASAP. We are hoping to find energetic, hard working, loyal new members to add to our constantly growing team. Try-out for the position on a week day starting at 8am. If we like you then you start full time asap! Hours are 8-4 Mon-Fri. You MUST BE BADGED.

Send resume, relevant work history, a PICTURE OF YOUR BADGE, and a little about yourself and we will respond with details on the next trial day! Requirements for position 21+, Colorado resident, with absolutely no felony charges, that already has their red card. And preferably has their MMED issued badge. Please send resume, picture of your badge, relevant work history, and a little about yourself and we will get back to you ASAP!

Job Title: Inventory Control Supervisor

Position Summary:

Responsible for the day to day inventory of the dispensary, delivery inventory and oversee production team to ensure proper levels of inventory at all times. Create and develop vendor relationships in conjunction with head purchaser to ensure proper inventory levels, track vendor consignment accounts and facilitate payment due to vendors.

Responsibilities and Duties

Duties and Responsibilities:

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Oversee dispensary team including but not limited to: Inventory, Production, Delivery Inventory Delivery Drivers, Dispatchers
  • Ensure proper time is effectively split between departments as needed
  • Ensure back stock of all delivery products are kept to par levels
  • Ensure all products are kept in their ideal state to preserve freshness and quality of each product
  • Ensure all technology platforms are updated with our most current information (Weedmaps, Leafly, Delivery Platforms, etc)
  • Coordinate daily specials with Lead Buyer to ensure proper turnover of inventory and selling out of expiring products
  • Oversee monthly inventory and report any loss runs to partners & operations officers
  • Communicate effectively with FHO managers and production employees to identify any current or upcoming needs
  • Be cognizant of marketing calendar and upcoming events to anticipate ordering needs
  • Ensure Production team is always busy and on task
  • Handle all orders, deliveries, receiving, returns, and exchanges with vendors
  • Assist operations team in creating sales incentives for the sales staff
  • Approve all invoices for payables and ensure clear communication with accounting department
  • Communicate effectively with operations and accounting department to coordinate expected vendor reconciliation payouts
  • Responsible for receiving all product, creating new items, deleting old items, checking in products, scanning invoices, loading to vendor docs
  • Responsible for all vendor payments and account upkeep
  • Responsible for all office and MMJ product inventory and orders
  • Coordinate flower exchange from safe > day cage > floor
  • Ensure jars are reassigned with new strains and ensure proper pricing and labeling of all products on shelves
  • Manage delivery inventory, ensure cases are properly stocked and inventoried each day

Qualifications and Skills

Qualifications:

  • At least 1 year management experience in high volume establishments with extensive knowledge in the cannabis industry
  • Must be able to input and access information in the POS system, delivery systems, marketing outlets, computers, etc
  • Must be comfortable learning new skills
  • Must have a hands-on, proactive self starter

Skills and Attitudes:

Must be motivated, hard-working, and passionate. This position requires someone who is a strong leader with the ability to handle multiple tasks and responsibilities.

  • Must have ability to:

ï® Perform all job functions with attention to detail, speed and accuracy

ï® Work cohesively as a team with co-workers

ï®

  • Four yearsâ€™ relevant experience and/or training

Certificates, Licenses, and Registrations:

  • Must be able to sit for up to 8 hours at a time

Do you have what it takes to be a part of an industry leading cannabis company? We are Mayflower Medicinals â€“ a company dedicated to delivering the best products and services possible to the patients of Massachusetts.

Mayflower is one of the few license holders in Massachusetts and as such we are uniquely positioned for market leadership. We will be opening one of the 3 Boston approved dispensaries. In addition, we have invested in a 36,000sf state of the art cultivation facility to ensure maximum efficiency, productivity and quality of our products.

We are currently looking for a self-motivated, data driven individual to join our finance team located in Boston, MA. The Senior Accountantâ€™s job responsibilities will entail recurring and technical accounting as well as ad hoc projects and initiatives. The Senior Accountant is primarily responsible for supporting the Controller.

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Oversee payroll, accounts payable and receivable
  • Prepare daily / weekly / monthly / quarterly reconciliations as assigned for the dispensaries and grow / processing facility
  • Analyze financial reports - trend analysis, month over month variance analyses
  • Maintain company accounting procedures and processes documents

  • Contribute to financial management policies

  • Assist with audits and taxes

Qualifications and Skills

  • Good knowledge of U.S. GAAP and Tax accounting
  • Excellent and effective communication skills, both written and verbal and proofreading skills
  • Strong aptitude with Microsoft office products, specifically Excel, Word and Outlook
  • Proficiency with accounting software (SAP preferred) and experience with a POS system implementation a plus
  • Ability to solve problems and accomplish tasks with limited supervision, prioritize and multi-task
  • Ability to work quickly, accurately, and independently on a daily basis; requiring strong organizational skills, initiative and good judgment

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this position. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of the position. This job description is subject to change at any time.

Benefits

We offer a competitive salary based on experience and full suite of employer assisted benefits.

Mayflower Medicinals, Inc. (Mayflower) is part of a larger, well-capitalized network of companies brought together to support best-in-class licensed cannabis cultivators, processors and dispensaries throughout the United States. We are a patient first focused organization providing top quality medical cannabis in a compassionate, warm environment. Job Summary

Entry Level Grow Techs - Full-time // LaConte's Clone Bar & Dispensary

LaConte's retail store is looking for full-time Entry Level Grow Techs to join our team! Only applicants with open availability and badges will be considered, applicants who do not supply badge information will not be considered for this position! This position is full-time, working 40+ hours a week. Qualified candidates will be available nights and weekends.

This position is responsible for assisting the management team with the activities and operations of the grow, while abiding by policies, procedures and operational guidelines. Responsible for harvesting, de fanning, transplanting, cloning, cleaning, trimming and anything else that is needed while following full compliance & company policies. We're looking for hard-working, positive team players!

Responsibilities of the Entry Level Grow Techs include but are not limited to:

  • Harvesting Plants
  • De-fanning for contract trimmers
  • Weighing/Documenting trimmed product
  • Weighing/Documenting waste
  • Transplanting Plants
  • Cloning
  • Cleaning grow rooms after harvests
  • Wet and Dry trimming when needed (We expect a consistent speed and high quality product)
  • Being knowledgeable / willing to learn about many different cannabis strains
  • METRC experience a plus - Manifesting. Maintain open communication with the management team and other co-workers
  • Report / communicate employee issues

We require our Entry Level Grow Techs to:

  • Have a Colorado driver's license or State ID card
  • Have reliable transportation

Want to join a dynamic, growing CO2 manufacturer of raw CO2 products? Then WonderLeaf may be right for you. Find out if you are the right fit to join our team. We are seeking a self-motivated and experienced CO2 extraction technician.

We prefer you to have at least one year of CO2 extraction but if you have a lab background, a degree in a science such as Chemistry, Botany or other applicable sciences, then you may be the perfect candidate for us.

If you have the following skills and abilities, we would love to hear from you.

About WonderLeaf

WonderLeaf is a locally owned and operated recreational MIP. As a small batch, raw and uncut producer of quality cannabis concentrates and infused products, we value the relationships we build throughout the industry.

Our company was founded as a family, those of us who aren't related by blood are related by bonds of friendship. Our team is flexible and able to address all questions and issues quickly. We work hard and have fun while we do it.

Our lab team is driven by the science and art of making incredibly pure and raw products. We take great pride in what we do and we believe it shows in the final product. Tasting the WonderLeaf difference is believing.

If you want to see where science and art converge in making our products, join us in this incredible journey.

Job Description

This position is responsible for assisting in the manufacturing lab where the company produces marijuana infused products and has a multi-faceted environment, including: product extractions, research and development as well as factory settings for packaging of product for distribution.

This is a full-time position; days and hours may vary.

Benefits include paid vacations, medical and dental, paid holidays

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Preparing equipment and plant materials for extraction
  • Operating highly sophisticated extraction equipment
  • Processing concentrates and extracts
  • Cleaning and maintenance of extraction equipment and laboratory facility.
  • Ensuring the laboratory is well-stocked and resourced.
  • Recording and sometimes interpreting results to present to the Director of Laboratory Operations.
  • Using computers and performing mathematical calculations.
  • Keeping up to date with technical developments, especially those which can save time and improve reliability.
  • Conducting searches on identified topics relevant to the research.
  • Following and ensuring strict safety procedures and safety checks.
  • Maintains glassware by picking-up, cleaning, washing, sterilizing, and distributing.
  • Documentation and continued development of changing internal processes for department
  • Keeps laboratory supplies ready by inventorying stock and verifying receipt.
  • Keeps equipment operating by following operating instructions.
  • Documents information by maintaining daily logs and equipment record books.
  • Resolves problems by examining and evaluating data; selecting corrective steps.
  • Completes projects by assisting processors; attending and participating in meetings.
  • Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading technical publications.
  • Enhances laboratory and organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.
  • Prepares customer orders by fulfilling shipment requirements including the packaging and shipping of WonderLeaf products.
  • Ability to listen well and communicate effectively orally and in writing with various audiences.
  • Ability to use initiative and independent judgment appropriately.
  • Ability to interpret, understand, and comply with complex statutes, ordinances, regulations, standards, and laws.
  • Understanding of applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations as they pertain to the industry, personnel law, safety regulations, local municipal codes and organizational rules, regulations, directives and standard operating procedures.
  • Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees, management, governmental agencies, community members and the general public.
  • Must have strong communication skills with the ability to express ideas clearly and concisely in written and verbal formats.
  • Ability to use standard office equipment, computer equipment and software including word processing, data base management, METRC, spreadsheet applications and electronic mail.
  • Preparation, packaging and shipping of all WonderLeaf products.
  • Maintains active participation in at least one process improvement team.
  • Engages in regularly scheduled professional training and development activities offered by the company and others within the industry.
  • Promotes the positive, innovative culture of WonderLeaf and the legal marijuana industry.
  • Develops and delivers training and development activities to others within the company within their area of expertise.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications and Required Skills and Competencies

  • 4 Year Degree in science-related field, such as chemistry is preferred, but not mandatory.
  • 1-2 yearsâ€™ experience in a lab setting preferred
  • CO2 Extraction experience is highly preferred
  • Experience and understanding of the variety of tasks required in working in a lab setting.
  • Must possess and maintain a Support Employee badge from the Colorado Department of Marijuana Enforcement (MED).
  • Ability to work independently, manage projects and meet deadlines.
  • Strong organizational skills.
  • Must be able to work with others in a collaborative environment.

Working Conditions

  • This position works within a marijuana processing plant, the incumbent is exposed to the operation of extraction equipment, vacuum ovens, compressors, and other equipment.
  • The incumbent works with a variety of materials including CO2, ethanol and other solvents and reagents used in the extraction of marijuana components.
  • The incumbent works around and with a variety of nutrients, chemicals, compounds and other inert and active materials found in the growing of marijuana plants

Physical Requirements

  • This position requires long periods of standing, stooping, bending and working in a manufacturing environment.
  • The incumbent may be required to lift heavy objects on a regular basis including but not limited to CO2 canisters and other materials related to marijuana plants.
  • The incumbent works with agricultural chemicals, minerals, plants and other substances, elements and compounds as required.

Safety

  • Works in a safe manner, utilizing Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) as required for tasks and duties.
  • Follows and complies with Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) in the application of all supplies, chemicals, compounds and materials in the completion of tasks and duties.

Direct Reports

  • This is a non-supervisory position. There are no direct reports.
  • The extraction technician may provide temporary supervision over the work of contract or temporary employees as required

Company Summary:

Our client has an excellent opportunity for a Greenhouse Manager. Our newly constructed and upcoming greenhouse facilities are located on 24-acre site on the Arkansas River in the heart of the Rocky Mountains. Salida, Colorado is within the Arkansas River Headwaters RecreationalArea, surrounded by the Collegiate Peaks, and is a school district of distinction. The contemporary facility is 20K square feet of technical greenhouse, with additional 75K square feet to be substantially completed by January 2018.Our client is one of the largest cannabis flower and oil producers in Colorado, combining process manufacturing and advanced technologies.Position

Summary:

The Greenhouse Manager serves a crucial role in ensuring the greenhouse is run efficiently, effectively, and that the facility serves the production mission of our client.The Greenhouse Manager serves as the manager of the day-to-day operations of the greenhouse. We seek a highly organized, energetic, and flexible person to lead our greenhouse operations. Responsibilities include managing staff, developing policies and procedures to ensure smooth operations and to maximize efficiencies, plant cultivation and pest management, managing the control systems to maintain environmental conditions, allocation of space, managing the greenhouse budget, maintaining records, and coordinating maintenance needs with other company production units. The greenhouse must be staffed 7 days per week for plant care, requiring flexibility to work evenings, weekends, and holidays.Current permanent staffing consists of 14 FTE. The Greenhouse Manager reports to the Vice President of Operations and the Chief Executive Officer of the company.

Responsibilities:

Greenhouse Operations

  • Develop greenhouse operations plans, policies, and procedures, including plant care, health and safety operations; train and lead staff on policies and procedures.
  • Oversee, prepare and maintain plant materials used for production and research projects.
  • Implement best practices for plant health and care, paying attention to any specific cultural needs of specimens.
  • Carry out effective integrated pest control and management protocols.
  • Perform other horticultural tasks associated with the greenhouse operations.
  • Coordinate with propagation and harvest operations to optimize production of flower material.
  • Provide guidance and training to greenhouse personnel on plant cultivation, plant health care, and plant maintenance procedures.
  • Collect, analyze, and maintain data on greenhouse operations to aid strategic planning and operational decisions and activities. Communicate the information to our clientâ€™s management at least semi-annually.
  • Manage the cultivation of plants in a controlled environment.
  • Supervises and trains staff, controls inventory of plant material, creates progress reports, and ensures compliance with State and environmental safety regulations, and State regulations.

Greenhouse Facilities/Building Management

  • Supervise the operation of the greenhouse facility including the growing room temperature controls, energy curtain, blackout curtain, glazing, lighting, and watering systems.
  • Monitor climate equipment status and adjust as necessary to ensure proper functioning.
  • Coordinate maintenance needs and repairs with greenhouse staff, maintenance staff, operations management, and others as necessary.
  • Maintain inventory of all supplies and chemicals.
  • Ensure compliance with all PG environmental health and safety requirements.
  • Ensure compliance with all MED and CDA requirements.

Greenhouse Administrative Operations

  • Hire, train, and supervise staff (includes scheduling, oversight, training, and annual performance reviews).
  • Manage the greenhouse budgets and accounts. Analyze usage records to adjust cost rates as necessary. Monitor expenses and budget balances, forecast future expenses, and create budgets for the greenhouse.
  • Purchase supplies and occasional equipment for the greenhouse.

Preferred Qualifications

A masterâ€™s degree in horticulture, plant sciences, agriculture, or substantially similar field of study, and seven years or more experience as greenhouse manager.

Minimum Qualifications

A bachelorâ€™s degree in horticulture, plant sciences, or agriculture, and three years of experience in greenhouse management, OR an associateâ€™s degree in greenhouse management or the related fields of technical agricultural or floriculture, and five years of greenhouse experience, OR an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.

Overview

Want to join a dynamic, growing CO2 manufacturer of raw CO2 products? Then WonderLeaf may be right for you. Find out if you are the right fit to join our team. We are seeking a self-motivated and experience CO2 extraction technician.

If you have the following skills and abilities, we would love to hear from you.

Job Description

This position is responsible for assisting in the manufacturing lab where the company produces marijuana infused products and has a multi-faceted environment, including: product extractions, research and development as well as factory settings for packaging of product for distribution.

This is a full-time position; days and hours may vary.

Benefits include paid vacations, medical and dental, paid holidays

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Preparing equipment and plant materials for extraction
  • Operating highly sophisticated extraction equipment
  • Processing concentrates and extracts
  • Cleaning and maintenance of extraction equipment and laboratory facility.
  • Ensuring the laboratory is well-stocked and resourced.
  • Recording and sometimes interpreting results to present to the Director of Laboratory Operations.
  • Using computers and performing mathematical calculations.
  • Keeping up to date with technical developments, especially those which can save time and improve reliability.
  • Conducting searches on identified topics relevant to the research.
  • Following and ensuring strict safety procedures and safety checks.
  • Maintains glassware by picking-up, cleaning, washing, sterilizing, and distributing.
  • Documentation and continued development of changing internal processes for department
  • Keeps laboratory supplies ready by inventorying stock and verifying receipt.
  • Keeps equipment operating by following operating instructions.
  • Documents information by maintaining daily logs and equipment record books.
  • Resolves problems by examining and evaluating data; selecting corrective steps.
  • Completes projects by assisting processors; attending and participating in meetings.
  • Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading technical publications.
  • Enhances laboratory and organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.
  • Prepares customer orders by fulfilling shipment requirements including the packaging and shipping of WonderLeaf products.
  • Ability to listen well and communicate effectively orally and in writing with various audiences.
  • Ability to use initiative and independent judgment appropriately.
  • Ability to interpret, understand, and comply with complex statutes, ordinances, regulations, standards, and laws.
  • Understanding of applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations as they pertain to the industry, personnel law, safety regulations, local municipal codes and organizational rules, regulations, directives and standard operating procedures.
  • Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees, management, governmental agencies, community members and the general public.
  • Must have strong communication skills with the ability to express ideas clearly and concisely in written and verbal formats.
  •  Ability to use standard office equipment, computer equipment and software including word processing, data base management, METRC, spreadsheet applications and electronic mail.
  • Preparation, packaging and shipping of all WonderLeaf products.
  • Maintains active participation in at least one process improvement team.
  • Engages in regularly scheduled professional training and development activities offered by the company and others within the industry.
  • Promotes the positive, innovative culture of WonderLeaf and the legal marijuana industry.
  • Develops and delivers training and development activities to others within the company within their area of expertise.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications and Required Skills and Competencies

  •  4 Year Degree in science-related field, such as chemistry is preferred, but not mandatory.
  •  1-2 years’ experience in a lab setting preferred
  • CO2 Extraction experience is highly preferred
  •  Experience and understanding of the variety of tasks required in working in a lab setting.
  •  Must possess and maintain a Support Employee badge from the Colorado Department of Marijuana Enforcement (MED).
  •  Ability to work independently, manage projects and meet deadlines.
  •  Strong organizational skills.
  •  Must be able to work with others in a collaborative environment.

Working Conditions

  • This position works within a marijuana processing plant, the incumbent is exposed to the operation of extraction equipment, vacuum ovens, compressors, and other equipment.
  • The incumbent works with a variety of materials including CO2, ethanol and other solvents and reagents used in the extraction of marijuana components.
  • The incumbent works around and with a variety of nutrients, chemicals, compounds and other inert and active materials found in the growing of marijuana plants

Physical Requirements

  • This position requires long periods of standing, stooping, bending and working in a manufacturing environment.
  • The incumbent may be required to lift heavy objects on a regular basis including but not limited to CO2 canisters and other materials related to marijuana plants.
  •  The incumbent works with agricultural chemicals, minerals, plants and other substances, elements and compounds as required.

Safety

  • Works in a safe manner, utilizing Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) as required for tasks and duties.
  • Follows and complies with Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) in the application of all supplies, chemicals, compounds and materials in the completion of tasks and duties.

Direct Reports

  •  This is a non-supervisory position. There are no direct reports.
  • The extraction technician may provide temporary supervision over the work of contract or temporary employees as required.

 

Tagged as: Chemistry, CO2, Extraction

Position Summary

The SWC Trimming/Packaging Agent provides on-site support for the trimming and packaging of Sierra Wellness product. Completes tasks assigned by the facility manager to ensure the visual aesthetic and high quality of products. Carries out day-to-day tasks including plucking, trimming, hanging, and drying of products. Maintain excellent personal hygiene, workspace cleanliness, and quality control measures to ensure high quality product in accordance with the Division and standards set by Sierra Wellness.

This role does require you to sit for long periods of time, be organized, multitask, and adjust to a fast-paced and ever-changing environment. The packaging room is where agents spend most of their time and will be working in close quarters with a handful of other agents.

Due to the inherent needs of the cultivation facility, having flexible availability is a requirement which may include, but not limited to; working various weekday/evening and weekend shifts.

Core Duties

Listed below are the main responsibilities of the Trimming/Packaging Agent, but not limited to;

Responsibilities:

Packaging -

  • Maintain Sanitized Environment.
  • Break down pounds (quarters, eighths, grams, microbuds, shake).
  • Operate Cone Filling Machine, Scales, Vacuum & Sealer.
  • Maintain functioning PPE (gloves, mask, hairnet, lab coat, shoe covers).
  • Monitor all current stock levels.
  • Expert dry trim (removing crowâ€™s feet/excess leaf, tight trim).
  • Properly completing forms for each task.
  • Responsible for packaging shake into pre-rolls while utilizing the Knock Box for Sierra Wellness products.
  • Responsible for packaging of a wide range of Sierra Wellness products and maintaining an overall awareness for ensuring high quality and visual aesthetics for retail sale.

Trimming -

  • Responsible for trimming various SWC products to meet visual standards and styles to ensure the highest quality and consistency for packaged goods to be sold for retail in Sierra Wellness Dispensaries.
  • Also maintain a sanitized environment.
  • Trim individual strains and track accordingly.
  • Sort correct placement of cannabis products (big leaf, sugar, stem, floor waste).
  • Ensure clean dry room and hang wire racks.
  • Wash out all used (bins, pots, trays, scissors).
  • Clean and organize general facility (remove waste, sanitize restrooms, sweep & mop).
  • Wash equipment and tools as needed.
  • Refill stock of PPE.
  • Strictly adheres to hygienic and sanitation policies set by Sierra Wellness and Division requirements.
  • Perform all assigned duties required to ensure a clean and safe workspace and production facility.
  • Assist with the creation of labels in accordance with the Division and standards set by Sierra Wellness.
  • Assist in the weighing, packaging, labeling, and other activities as required.

On-Going:

  • Participate in discussions on how to improve processes and workflow, propose ideas to better company policies and procedures. Communicate with Manager about concerns.
  • Uniform and PPE upkeep and proper organization. Maintain and organize records and documents.
  • Practice proper time management skills.
  • Document interpersonal issues, keep staff informed about upcoming meetings and Cultivation facility happenings.
  • Support and assist co-workers when needed.
  • Maintain training requirements and personal development.
  • Maintain a positive attitude.

Qualifications

Two years of experience in a general production, preferably a regulated field producing for human consumption. Or, any satisfactory combination of experience and training which clearly demonstrates the ability to perform the above-described duties. Excellent personal hygiene, knowledge of medical marijuana law, medicinal benefits, and horticulture skills. Effective time-management skills and ability to multi-task. Ability to sit and trim for extended periods. Ability to work in a fast-paced, changing and challenging environment.

Must have a valid driverâ€™s license and provide fingerprints for background check to be considered.

May not have a violent felony conviction or drug related offense.

companyName: Kelan John Farrell-Smith for President in 2020
jobDescription:
This job posting is aimed towards hiring unpaid (at first) interns for a 2020 United States Presidential Campaign.

Kelan John Farrell-Smith (R-CA) is a true Washington outsider, not rich or famous in any way, but is a young, 35-year-old political up-and-comer who is tired of seeing the same few (unqualified) families being promoted for political office by the media. He holds a B.A. in Psychology from California State University-Northridge, an M.S. in Clinical Psychology and an M.B.A. in International Business from California Lutheran University, as well as an M.A. in Politics from Claremont Graduate University. He is a political scholar, and is also an accomplished musician, having performed numerous classical masterworks as a member of the choir at Pomona College.

He works as a consultant.

Kelan was a longtime Democrat, having voted for Gore in 2000, Kerry in 2004, and Obama in 2008 and 2012. He supported the notion of a female President, and was a supporter of Elizabeth Warren in 2016. When it became public knowledge that the Hillary Clinton campaign had colluded with Debbie Wasserman-Schultz, former Democratic Party Chairperson, to prevent Warren and Bernie Sanders from competing with Hillary on an even playing field in the 2016 Democratic primaries, Kelan became enraged with the Democratic Party, switched parties, and ultimately voted for Donald Trump.

After watching Trump's performance in The White House for the past year (lots of controversies, firings, etc.), Kelan regrets his decision to vote for Trump, and has decided to go right at him by running as a Republican. He contemplated running as a Democrat, because he supports LGBTA+ equality, inclusion in the workplace, and the legalization of medicinal cannabis, but feels that it would be more efficient to challenge Donald Trump directly as a Republican, given the fact that many Republicans are dismayed by Donald Trump's short tenure in office.

Kelan was educated by many prominent conservative (and liberal) professors while a doctoral student at Claremont, and respects the opinions of both parties, as Americans.

Kelan's primary campaign platform is that of true campaign finance reform consisting of equal funding for all presidential candidates, because he thinks that every constitutionally eligible person should be given a chance to run for political office, not just the rich and the famous.

Currently, Mr. Farrell-Smith's campaign is seeking motivated political interns who would like to see real change in Washington, DC. He favors the idea that being educated in politics should outweigh being rich or famous, at least as far as presidential campaigns are concerned.

Job responsibilities: cold calling, polling, fundraising, etc.

Work experience: no prior political campaign experience is required

Required education: a bachelor's or master's degree in political science, politics, constitutional law, or political philosophy (political theory) is preferred, however current undergraduate college students in those fields, as well as other related fields, are encouraged to apply

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Required education:

  • High school or equivalent

FLRish, a company providing management services to the renowned Harborside Health Center medical cannabis dispensaries and building cultivation operations for vertical integration under CA state law, is seeking qualified applicants to apply for the role of Compliance Specialist .

PLEASE NOTE: All applications MUST be accompanied by a cover letter that clearly describes your interest in the medical cannabis industry. Any application received without such a cover letter will not be considered.

ABOUT US

Founded in 2015 by Steve DeAngelo, Harborside Farms cultivates medical cannabis for our Harborside dispensaries located in Oakland and San Jose. Harborside is one of the most respected and largest medical cannabis dispensaries in the United States. With over 200,000 registered patients Harborside was first in the nation to support education for seniors, veterans and families with severely ill children; the first to offer CBD-rich medicine; and the first to treat children with Dravet syndrome. Harborside continues to set an example of diversity and compliance, and is one of the prime advocates of diversity, sustainability and economic justice in the industry.

Our work is dear to our hearts, and so vital to the communities we serve. We hope all our employees find their work to be both challenging, and to carry the unique reward of knowing at the end of the day that they have done something that truly matters. We provide a competitive wage, medical, dental and vision insurance, an employer-matched 401k program, an Employee Assistance Program, FSA/Commuter Benefits, and paid time off to qualified staff members.

Harborside/ FLRish is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, present or history of mental disability, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law. EOE.

COMPLIANCE SPECIALIST

(FULL-TIME)

SUMMARY:

The Compliance Specialist assists in the development and implementation of compliance programs for the organization. Advises management on matters relating to organizational ethics and compliance. Monitors business activities for compliance with applicable rules and regulations. Ensures operating manuals and procedural documents stay current when regulations change. Assists with responding to inquiries from regulatory agencies and completes required compliance documentation.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES: (This list is not intended to be all inclusive)

  • Manages issues relating to ethics and compliance within the organization and ensures all issues are appropriately evaluated, investigated and resolved, and that confidentiality of information is maintained.
  • Conducts compliance risk assessment reviews and identifies potential areas of compliance vulnerability and risk.
  • Collaborates with business units, area offices, project sites and functions and directs ethics and compliance issues to the appropriate existing channels for investigation and resolution.
  • Develops/implements corrective action plans for resolution of problematic issues, and provides guidance for avoidance of similar issues in the future.
  • Under direction of Compliance Manager oversees the institution of an effective program for the organization to heighten awareness of ethics and compliance.
  • Regularly monitors all departments of company properties for any SOP compliance violations as well as review of video security system.
  • Follow company procedures for reporting violations and reporting said violations substantiated with documented and video evidence to Compliance Director.
  • Consults with the Compliance Director or their designee to determine whether any additional compliance training is indicated to supplement the companywide core compliance training curriculum and, if so,- Develops an appropriate supplemental compliance education plan for appropriate staff;- Maintains appropriate records to track compliance with the plan;- Provides periodic reports as needed and requested to the Compliance Director or their designee on progress against the plan; and- Periodically reviews the plan to ensure compliance with these procedure
  • Assist in the preparation and completion of an annual compliance risk assessment and develop an annual compliance review schedule.
  • Performs additional tasks and duties at the request of the Compliance Director or their designee.

PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS: (Knowledge, Skills and Abilities)

  • Advanced knowledge of POS and any other organizational inventory management system.
  • Knowledgeable in data analysis and interpretation.
  • Demonstrated passion to serve the medical cannabis community.
  • Outstanding customer relations skills.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Understanding of basic accounting principles and able to interpret financial data.
  • Intermediate math skills.
  • Advanced computer operating skills.
  • Knowledgeable in Microsoft Office Suite, with advanced knowledge in Excel.
  • Ability to work with databases and spreadsheets to create reports.

GENERAL PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS

  • Provide excellent service.
  • Present a professional image in appearance, actions and words.
  • Demonstrate ownership, accountability, initiative and quality of work.
  • Build positive team relationships throughout your department and the company.
  • Follow all safety policies
  • Be a role model for the company experience.
  • Understand and practice company values.
  • Demonstrate ethical behavior.
  • Understand & contribute to the positive culture of the organization.

Physical Requirements

  • Work is generally performed seated and requires some bending, stooping and reaching.
  • Work is generally performed in an office type setting, in a farm setting, or over the phone.
  • Work will require regular travel within California and may include limited travel outside of California.
  • Lifting up to 50 pounds.
  • Frequent contact with others via email, face-to-face discussions, and telephone.
  • Some communication required via mail and fax.

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Typical Working Conditions

  • Frequent contact with others via email, face-to-face discussions, and telephone.

Education and Experience Required:

  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to coordinate activities with varying levels of management and staff.
  • Must exhibit excellent time-management skills by achieving departmental goals and objectives, while working in a high workload environment.
  • Understands and performs complex and detailed work with accuracy.
  • Ability to be diplomatic and persuasive in situations requiring those qualities.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently, yet function within the corporate structure.
  • Superior maturity and tact, with the ability to exercise judgment, initiative and discretion regarding confidential and sensitive matters.
  • Ability to organize and analyze data and information gathered to support investigative findings and document the effectiveness of the ethics and compliance program.
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Bachelor degree in finance, business management, law or other compliance related discipline from an accredited college or university, sufficient number of specialized courses, or equivalent demonstrated experience in an Ethics and Compliance related discipline or function.

Sweet Leaf is growing and adding an Overnight Plant Work Team! This team is responsible for the efficiency and quality of the marijuana plants in all aspects for preparation of sale. The team will support the overall grow operations and assisting to run the grow overnight, while working with a team of peers in the accurate and efficient caretaking of cannabis plants in accordance to Sweet Leaf policies and procedures while maintaining a contaminate free work space.

This is an overnight position working 3-4 nights a week with shifts from 6 pm to 4 am. In order to be considered, applicants must have a industry MED Support or Key Badge.

Responsibilities include:

  • Skirting plants which requires using both hands and pruning shears to cut off lower hanging branches and pluck dead or infected leaves from the plant to promote growth and overall plant health.
  • Defoliating which requires, using hands to pull leaves off from inner parts of the plant to allow for better air flow & light penetration.
  • Tying which requires using hands while standing to tie a knot around the branch of the plant -- tie the other end of the plastic tape at a 45-degree angle to the stake above the plant.
  • Tying and staking plants including the stake, extensions, tie angle, position on branch, quantity, proper support, spending about 10-15 minutes per plant.
  • Cleaning including removing dead leaves from inside of the pot and from the floor using a broom and pan.
  • Assist with Harvest including: de-fan, top colas, plant waste, paperwork, tie removal, dumping pots, stacking stakes, cleanup.
  • Harvest hang-dry including: de-fan, wet trim, hang whole plant vs. sections, weigh plant, clean-up, 20-30 mins per plant.
  • Assist with De-Boning which includes 2 people 10 plants per hour, cut vs snap off, no shucking, timing, separation of medical and recreational.
  • Basic cleaning including sweeping an mopping of all work areas, walk-throughs, degreasing, mop with bleach.
  • Clean bathrooms including: sweeping, mopping, stocking supplies, emptying trash, cleaning the sink, and toilet of the warehouse and office.
  • Cleaning pots, trays, stakes, orange buckets including: scrubbing old roots and nutrients out thoroughly using metal brush, bleach then water dunk, stack, clean sink area, change water drum as needed, store pots.

Qualifications:

  • High school diploma or General Education Diploma (GED).
  • Excellent computer, math, language, and reasoning skills.

  • Familiarity with warehouse procedures.

  • Ability to handle confidential and sensitive information.
  • Basic weights and measurement skills, ability to operate a scale.
  • Must be a minimum of 21 years of age.
  • Must have a MED Support or Key Badge.

Orewan, LLC is seeking an Operations Assistant for their facility in Salem, Oregon. This person will report to the Director of Operations for our Wana Brands infused cannabis product manufacturing facility, licensed with and operating under all rules and regulations of the State of Oregon. This person will help to develop and manage systems, processes and communications that allow the Salem facility to maintain quality production, meet production targets, and coordinate with the Colorado Wana Brands home office on all relevant matters. This person will work with the Director and with floor managers to help this 15+-person operation move through its next stage of growth. Specific duties and qualifications are listed below.

Job Duties

  • Provide coordination and communication assistance to Director of Operations. Provide support for regular staff and management meetings, coordinate calendars, facilitate communication with the Wana Brands home office, schedule travel and outside meetings, and prepare weekly priority work lists for key employees.
  • Manage systems that measure the performance of the facility. Provide reports on range of production metrics and compliance with state and local regulations. Work with production managers to ensure that all data collection and QC tasks are complete each day.
  • Work in tandem with Production Manager to help schedule production and meet production targets. Provide reports, perform analyses, generate daily dashboard (build on what our Production Manager is already preparing),
  • Oversee purchasing of materials and subsequent management of inventories. Work with Wana Brands home office purchasing/warehouse team to integrate systems where appropriate and attain assistance on other purchasing issues. Work with Inflow software to help manage inventory and purchasing needs.

  • Work with and support project management software (Wrike) for all projects.

  • Coordinate hiring of new staff.

Expectations

We are searching for a candidate who can learn software quickly and then can work with those systems effectively and creatively. Experience and knowledge of basic database principles will be helpful.

  • Project management skills in regards to managing projects, organizing projects, tracking projects and drivng projects to completion.
  • This will be a competitively set salary based position.

About Master Growers

Welcome to Master Growers Extracts.
Founded in 2014, with the primary mission of introducing people, and educating patients about the miraculous healing properties of whole plant cannabis medicine.  MG’s products have been specifically developed to help patients reduce pain and inflammation, improve the quality of their lives, and maintain a healthy existence.

The MG ACO (Alcohol Clear Oil) extraction process produces a higher quality cannabis concentrate that is easier for the body to absorb. All MG products are lab tested and certified, using only the highest quality organic ingredients. The MG ACO process preserves the natural cannabinoids, terpenes and other healthy compounds of the whole cannabis plant.  Chlorophyll and lipids are isolated and removed during the extraction process yielding a smoother product, that is easier for your  body to digest and utilize.  Our unique production method crafts an extremely safe, consistent and highly effective product.  Benefits of whole plant cannabis extract may include: reducing arthritic pain, alleviating insomnia, boosting immunity, easing symptoms of auto-immune disorders, and reducing hypertension.

Master Growers is committed to consistently delivering high quality products, while continuing to raise health awareness and creating healthy, empowered communities.

The Trim Technician trims all harvested cannabis plants to separate out the various parts of the plant based upon their value. These positions will work many hours while seated or standing, and remain completely focused on efficiently trimming plants and maintaining expected production levels. Based upon company needs, they may perform hand-trimming either wet or dry, and they may or may not use trimming machines. Duties may also include weighing and packaging accordingly.

Extraction

The Extraction Technician has the responsibility of safely and effectively converting cannabis plant into medical cannabis oils and liquids for ingestion, inhalation, or topical application. The qualified individual will possess a keen interest and knowledge of chemistry.

Responsibilities:

  • Preparing equipment and plant materials for extraction
  • Operating highly sophisticated extraction equipment
  • Processing concentrates and extracts
  • Cleaning and maintenance of extraction equipment and laboratory facility
  • Maintaining strict inventory records of all plant materials, chemicals and equipment used in the laboratory
  • Operating, maintaining, and making adjustments and repairs to laboratory equipment such as liquid chromatography systems, pumps, microscopes, balances, centrifuges, and other laboratory equipment
  • Maintaining inventory records of supplies, materials, and equipment, and preparing requisitions as needed
  • Storing supplies and equipment, disposal of waste according to guidelines, and keeping laboratory, storerooms and working areas immaculate
  • Washing and sterilizing laboratory glassware
  • Performing clerical work related to laboratory activities such as word processing, record keeping
  • Maintaining material safety data sheets for all department chemicals and products
  • Performs related duties as assigned

Knowledge:

  • Principles of biochemistry, organic and inorganic chemistry
  • Scientific laboratory procedures and techniques as used in a chemistry laboratory
  • Scientific laboratory equipment and apparatus
  • Scientific methods of measurements
  • Health and safety practices and precautions applicable to a chemistry laboratory
  • Proper and safe handling and disposal of harmful chemicals, substances, and hazardous wastes

Physical Demands:

Include standing, bending, and lifting up to 50 pounds by themselves and 75+ pounds with a buddy, carrying product, moving and making adjustments to process equipment.

Job Summary

Manufacturing Technician

We are a progressive and forward-thinking company whose business is cannabis. Our members are respected and recognized for their exemplary responsible business practices and political work. Our commitment is unparalleled in the new industry. Individually, our company's leaders have significant talent, experience in their respective industries, and a record of strong performance.

Our company operates under the highest standards of professionalism. You will be expected to follow all applicable laws and regulations, and all company policies, procedures, and practices as they apply to security, verification, and inventory plans.

We are seeking experienced individuals who bring either a traditional science/laboratory background and/or experience in the botanical extraction process for high grade cannabis oils. You will be a member of a team who are responsible for the day-to-day operation of manufacturing in the highly-regulated California cannabis industry. Level of job will be driven by experience. Career pathing for growth is available. You will be expected to follow all the applicable regulations, and all company policies, procedures, and practices as applicable to the security, inventory, and verification plans.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Perform all the tasks in the center including: raw plant acquisition, operating/cleaning equipment, packaging, quality checking, testing, labeling, and entering into traceability software waste disposal and inventory management. * Ability to work well in a small team environment. * Ability to follow instructions for production scheduling and organization to precisely perform all processing needs on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis to keep product fresh and expenses low. * Cataloging and analyzing each individual strain via software. * Execute preventative maintenance and elimination of all types of mold, powdery mildew, spider mites, root aphids, fungus gnats, etc.
  • Maintain a clean and organized work environment. * In-depth knowledge of test results, supply ordering of inventory for labels, containers, cleaning fluids etc. * Flexible to new techniques and insight to expand knowledge in this new industry. * Comprehensive knowledge of Strains; Sativa, Indica and Hybrids and knowledge of effects of strains.
  • Assist state and local government auditors and law enforcement with inventory, sales and compliance audits. * Comply with all HR policies including confidentiality and non-disclosure.
  • All other functions as designated by the Senior management (where applicable).

Competency Requirements:

  • You are at least 21 years of age.
  • Laboratory experience in botanical extracts.
  • Experience with packaging and labeling.
  • Knowledge of the cannabis plant and genetics.
  • Must be able to provide references. * Must have accountability, proactive behavior and strong attention to detail.
  • Must be able to pass required city and state background checks.
  • Good mechanical aptitude and manual dexterity. * Proficiencies in building trades including painting, plumbing, seating, and equipment repair. * Excellent administrative and follow up skills. * Ability to work effectively with supervisors and co-workers. * Excellent communication skills and the ability to provide clear and concise details when interacting with peers.
  • Ability to follow instructions on safe use of all chemicals/cleaning materials. * Ability to perform tasks with tools, ladders, and lifts in a safe and effective manner. * High degree of attention to detail to perform facility inspections on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis. * Verbal communication skills, and accurate math skills.
  • Ability to work with traceability software and reporting. * Ability to work in a fast pace environment.
  • Standing, walking, lifting, twisting, and bending on a frequent basis. * Ability to lift up to 50 pounds and carry it up to 90 feet (or deposit into dumpster or trash compactor). * Ability to work and meet deadlines with minimal supervision. NOTICE: Our company utilizes a vendor to conduct a background check on all new hires upon acceptance of an offer of employment. Information collected in this application will be verified during the background check process.

The Tissue Culture Manager position is a hands-on position to support micro-propagation of cannabis plants. The role will manage the Tissue Culture Lab processes and all its employees. This position will also be involved with learning the current processes, cross training existing team members where needed, and assisting in building a team to address large scale tissue culture demands for production and quality.
Essential Functions 
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 

Supervisory tasks such as writing and giving performance reviews for the team, setting individual and team goals and expectations, providing support for the team to learn and grow, monitoring of routine production activities, and providing gap analysis and resource planning
Performing large scale tissue culture activities to support multiple MedMen production areas
Ensures that all work areas are kept clean and organized
Assisting with planning and troubleshooting as needed
Updating tissue culture and other databases with samples and results
Drafting, editing and following SOP’s and batch records
Work in conjunction with Cultivation Manager on production scheduling and crop cycles

Competencies 

Business Acumen.
Communication Proficiency.
Customer/Client Focus.
Organizational Skills.
Problem Solving/Analysis.
Results Driven.
Technical Capacity.
Punctuality
Positive attitude all the time
Open minded, team player
Independent, decisive and ability to work in a cross functional team
Ability to work with computer programs such as MS Word, Excel etc.

Supervisory Responsibility
This position manages all hourly employees of the department and is responsible for the performance management and hiring of the employees within that department in partnership with The Human Resources Department. 
Work Environment
This job normally in a laboratory setting environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands and fingers to handle, feel, or operate objects, tools or controls, and reach with hands and arms. The employee is frequently required to stand, talk and hear. 
The noise level in the work environment can be loud, tight corners and work spaces. Extensive walking and equipment operation. Work time expectation: 50% of time will be physical labor, 40% supervision and 10% training and misc.
Physical Demands
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Some examples are: lifting up to 50 pounds, some work with hands above head, bending over for extended period, and working in tight, dusty, cold, hot, spaces, etc. Working with hazardous chemicals will be associated with this position.
Position Type/Expected Hours of Work
This is a full-time position, and hours of work and days are Monday through Friday, 7:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Occasional evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand. (Subject to change)
Travel
Minimal travel is expected for this position.
Required Education and Experience

Must be at least 21 years of age
Bachelor of Science (B.Sc.) or Master Degree (M.Sc.) in Tissue Culture or related field
4 years or more of previous experience with plant based cell culture techniques
Previous experience working in an ISO, QSR, or cGMP compliant environment
Experience and confidence in working in an aseptic laboratory setting
Previous supervisory experience
Excellent communication skills and attention to detail.
Effective time-management skills and ability to multitask.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, changing, and challenging environment

Work Authorization/Security Clearance
There is no visa or H1-B sponsorship. Must successful complete and pass background and drug screen, and live scan or FBI Fingerprint requirements.



About MedMen
MedMen is a leading cannabis firm based in Los Angeles with operations and exposure across North America. The Firm consists of two main components; a management company and a capital arm.
MedMen Management is the premier full service management company serving the cannabis industry. The company offers turnkey services to license holders in the areas of cultivation, extraction, production and retail operations.
MedMen Capital guides investors through a space that has traditionally lacked institutional operators. Through MedMen Capital, the Firm makes strategic investments in key markets across the U.S. and Canada.
